1.1: Blessed is the man who walks not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stands in the path of sinners, nor sits in the seat of scoffers;
1.2: but his delight is in the law of the Lord, and in His law he meditates day and night.
1.3: He will be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that brings forth its fruit in its season; its leaf will not wither, and whatever he does will prosper.
1.4: The ungodly are not so, but are like the chaff which the wind drives away.
1.5: Therefore the ungodly will not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.
1.6: For the Lord knows the way of the righteous, but the way of the ungodly will perish.

2.1: Why do the nations rage, and the peoples plot in vain?
2.2: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the Lord and against His anointed, saying,
2.3: “Let us tear off their bonds and cast away their ropes from us.”
2.4: He who sits in the heavens laughs; the Lord ridicules them.
2.5: Then He will speak to them in His wrath and terrify them in His burning anger:
2.6: “I have installed My king on Zion, My holy hill.”
2.7: I will declare the decree of the Lord: He said to me, “You are My son; this day have I begotten you.
2.8: Ask of Me, and I will give you the nations for your inheritance, and the ends of the earth for your possession.
2.9: You will break them with a scepter of iron; you will dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.”
2.10: Now then, you kings, be wise; be admonished, you judges of the earth.
2.11: Serve the Lord with fear; tremble with trepidation!
2.12: Kiss the son, lest He become angry, and you perish in the way, for His wrath kindles in a flash. Blessed are all who seek refuge in Him.

3.1: Lord, how my foes have multiplied! Many rise up against me!
3.2: Many are saying about my life, “There is no help for him in God.” Selah
3.3: But You, O Lord, are a shield for me, my glory and the One who raises up my head.
3.4: I cried to the Lord with my voice, and He answered me from His holy hill. Selah
3.5: I lay down and slept; I awoke, for the Lord sustained me.
3.6: I will not be afraid of multitudes of people who have set themselves against me all around.
3.7: Arise, O Lord; save me, O my God! For You have struck all my enemies on the cheek; You have broken the teeth of the wicked.
3.8: Salvation belongs to the Lord. Your blessing is on Your people. Selah

4.1: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness! You have given me relief when I was in distress; have mercy on me, and hear my prayer.
4.2: O people, how long will you turn my glory into shame? How long will you love vanity and seek after lies? Selah
4.3: Know that the Lord set apart the faithful for Himself; the Lord hears when I call to Him.
4.4: Tremble in awe, and do not sin. Commune with your own heart on your bed, and be still. Selah
4.5: Offer sacrifices of righteousness, and trust in the Lord.
4.6: Many are saying, “Who will show us any good?” Lift up the light of Your face over us.
4.7: You have placed gladness in my heart that is better than when their corn and their new wine abound.
4.8: I will both lie down in peace and sleep; for You, Lord, make me dwell safely and securely.

5.1: Give ear to my words, O Lord; consider my meditation.
5.2: Listen to the voice of my cry, my King and my God, for to You will I pray.
5.3: O Lord, in the morning You will hear my voice; in the morning I will direct my prayer to You, and I will watch expectantly.
5.4: For You are not a God who has pleasure in wickedness, nor will evil dwell with You.
5.5: Those who boast will not stand in Your sight; You hate all workers of iniquity.
5.6: You will destroy those who speak lies; the Lord abhors the bloodthirsty and deceitful man.
5.7: But as for me, in the abundance of Your mercy I will enter Your house; in fear of You I will worship at Your holy temple.
5.8: Lead me, O Lord, in Your righteousness because of my enemies; make Your way straight before me.
5.9: For there is no uprightness in their mouth; destruction is in their midst; their throat is an open tomb; they flatter with their tongue.
5.10: Declare them guilty, O God; may they fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions, for they have rebelled against You.
5.11: But may all those who seek refuge in You rejoice; may they ever shout for joy, because You defend them; may those who love Your name be joyful in You.
5.12: For You, Lord, will bless the righteous; You surround him with favor like a shield.

6.1: O Lord, do not rebuke me in Your anger, nor discipline me in the heat of Your anger.
6.2: Be gracious to me, O Lord, for I am weak; O Lord, heal me, for my bones are terrified.
6.3: My soul is greatly troubled, but You, O Lord, how long?
6.4: Return, O Lord, rescue my soul. Save me for the sake of Your lovingkindness.
6.5: For in death there is no remembrance of You; in Sheol who will give You thanks?
6.6: I am weary with my groaning; all night I flood my bed with weeping; I drench my couch with my tears.
6.7: My eye wastes away from grief; it grows weak because of all those hostile to me.
6.8: Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity; for the Lord has heard the voice of my weeping.
6.9: The Lord has heard my supplication; the Lord accepts my prayer.
6.10: May all my enemies be ashamed and greatly terrified; may they turn back and be suddenly ashamed.

7.1: O Lord my God, in You I put my trust; save me from all those who persecute me, and deliver me,
7.2: lest they tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
7.3: O Lord my God, if I have done this, if there is iniquity in the palms of my hands,
7.4: if I have repaid evil to him who was at peace with me, or have delivered my adversary without cause,
7.5: then may the enemy pursue my life and overtake me; may my enemy trample my life to the ground, and lay my honor in the dust. Selah
7.6: Arise, O Lord, in Your anger; rise up because of the rage of my adversaries, and awaken Yourself for me; You have commanded justice.
7.7: The congregation of the peoples surround You; return above it to heaven’s heights.
7.8: The Lord will judge the peoples; grant me justice, O Lord, according to my righteousness, and according to my integrity within me.
7.9: May the evil of the wicked come to an end; may You vindicate the righteous one; You are a righteous God who examines the minds and hearts.
7.10: My defense depends on God, who saves the upright in heart.
7.11: God is a righteous judge, and God has indignation every day.
7.12: If one does not repent, God will sharpen His sword; He has bent His bow and made it ready.
7.13: He has prepared for Himself deadly weapons; He makes His arrows flaming shafts.
7.14: The wicked man writhes in pain of iniquity; he has conceived mischief and brought forth falsehood.
7.15: He who digs a hole and hollows it will then fall into his own pit.
7.16: His mischief will return on his own head; his violence will descend on the crown of his own head.
7.17: I will thank the Lord according to His righteousness, and will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.

8.1: O Lord, our Lord, how excellent is Your name in all the earth! You have set Your glory above the heavens.
8.2: Out of the mouth of babes and nursing infants You have ordained strength because of Your enemies, to silence the enemy and the avenger.
8.3: When I consider Your heavens, the work of Your fingers, the moon and the stars, which You have established,
8.4: what is man that You are mindful of him, and the son of man that You attend to him?
8.5: For You have made him a little lower than the angels, and crowned him with glory and honor.
8.6: You have given him dominion over the works of Your hands; You have put all things under his feet,
8.7: all sheep and oxen, and also the beasts of the field,
8.8: the birds of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatever travels the paths of the seas.
8.9: O Lord, our Lord, how excellent is Your name in all the earth!

9.1: I will give thanks to You, O Lord, with my whole heart; I will declare all Your marvelous works.
9.2: I will be glad and rejoice in You; I will sing praise to Your name, O Most High.
9.3: When my enemies are turned back, they will stumble and perish at Your presence.
9.4: For You have maintained my right and my cause; You sat on the throne judging what is right.
9.5: You have rebuked the nations, You have destroyed the wicked, You have wiped out their name forever and ever.
9.6: O you enemy, destructions have come to you for a perpetual end. You have destroyed cities; their memory perished with them.
9.7: But the Lord remains forever; He has established His throne for judgment.
9.8: He will judge the world in righteousness; He will give judgment to the peoples in uprightness.
9.9: The Lord also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.
9.10: Those who know Your name will put their trust in You, for You, Lord, have not forsaken those who seek You.
9.11: Sing praises to the Lord who dwells in Zion; declare His deeds among the people.
9.12: He who avenges deaths remembers them; He does not forget the cry of the humble.
9.13: Be gracious to me, O Lord; consider my trouble from those who hate me, O You who lifts me up from the gates of death,
9.14: that I may recount all Your praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion, that I may rejoice in Your salvation.
9.15: The nations have sunk down in the pit that they made; their own foot is caught in the net which they hid.
9.16: The Lord is known by the judgment that He executes; the wicked one is snared in the work of his own hands. Meditation. Selah
9.17: The wicked will be turned to Sheol, and all the nations that forget God.
9.18: For the needy will not always be forgotten, nor will the hope of the poor perish forever.
9.19: Arise, O Lord, may mortals not prevail; let the nations be judged in Your sight.
9.20: Put them in fear, O Lord, that the nations themselves may know they are mortals. Selah

10.1: Why do You stand far off, O Lord? Why do You hide Yourself in times of trouble?
10.2: In arrogance the wicked persecutes the poor; let them be caught in the devices they have planned.
10.3: For the wicked boasts of his soul’s desire; he blesses the greedy and despises the Lord.
10.4: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek God; God is not in all his thoughts.
10.5: His ways are always prosperous; Your judgments are high and distant from him; as for all his enemies, they scoff at him.
10.6: He says in his heart, “I shall not be moved; for generations I shall not meet adversity.”
10.7: His mouth is filled with cursing and deceit and oppression; under his tongue is mischief and iniquity.
10.8: He sits in the lurking places of the villages; in the secret places he murders the innocent; his eyes lurk against the unfortunate.
10.9: He lies in wait secretly as a lion in his den; he lies in wait to catch the poor; he catches the poor, drawing them into his net.
10.10: He crouches; he lies low, so that the unfortunate fall by his strength.
10.11: He says in his heart, “God has forgotten; He hides His face; He will never see it.”
10.12: Arise, O Lord! O God, lift up Your hand! Do not forget the humble.
10.13: Why do the wicked despise God? He says in his heart, “You will require an account.”
10.14: You have seen it, for You observe trouble and grief, to repay it with Your hand. The unfortunate one entrusts it to You; You are the helper of the orphan.
10.15: Break the arm of the wicked and the evil man; seek out his wickedness until You find none.
10.16: The Lord is King forever and ever; the nations perished from His land.
10.17: The desire of the humble You have heard, O Lord; You make their heart attentive; You bend Your ear
10.18: to judge the orphan and the oppressed; man on earth no longer trembles.

11.1: In the Lord I seek refuge; how do you say to my soul, “Flee as a bird to your mountain,
11.2: for the wicked bend their bow; they make ready their arrow on the string, that they may treacherously shoot the upright in heart.
11.3: If the foundations are broken, what can the righteous do?”
11.4: The Lord is in His holy temple, His throne is in heaven; His eyes see, His eyes examine mankind.
11.5: The Lord tests the righteous, but the wicked and one who loves violence His soul hates.
11.6: Upon the wicked He will rain coals of fire and brimstone and a burning wind; this will be the portion of their cup.
11.7: For the righteous Lord loves righteousness; His countenance beholds the upright.

12.1: Help, Lord, for the godly man comes to an end, for the faithful disappear from sons of men.
12.2: They speak empty words, each with his own neighbor; they speak with flattering lips and a double heart.
12.3: The Lord will cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaks proud things,
12.4: who have said, “With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are in our control, who is master over us?”
12.5: “Because the poor are plundered, because the needy sigh, now I will arise,” says the Lord; “I will place him in the safety for which he yearns.”
12.6: The words of the Lord are pure words; they are silver tried in an earthen furnace refined seven times.
12.7: You will keep them, O Lord; You will preserve them from this generation.
12.8: The wicked walk on every side, when the worthless of mankind are exalted.

13.1: How long, O Lord? Will You forget me for good? How long will you hide Your face from me?
13.2: How long will I harbor cares in my soul and sorrow in my heart by day? How long will my enemy loom over me?
13.3: Take note and answer me, O Lord my God! Brighten my eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death,
13.4: lest my enemy say, “I have him,” lest my foes exult when I stumble.
13.5: I for my part confide in Your kindness; may my heart exult in Your salvation!
13.6: I will sing to the Lord, because He has dealt bountifully with me.

14.1: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.” They are corrupt, they do abominable deeds, there is none who does good.
14.2: The Lord looks down from heaven on the children of men, to see if there are any who understand, who seek God.
14.3: They all turn aside, together they become corrupt; there is none who does good, not even one.
14.4: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge, who eat my people as they eat bread, but do not call on the Lord?
14.5: There they were in great fear, for God is with the generation of the righteous.
14.6: You shame the counsel of the poor, but the Lord is his refuge.
14.7: Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come from Zion! When the Lord turns back the captivity of His people, Jacob will rejoice, and Israel will be glad.

15.1: Lord, who will abide in Your tabernacle? Who will dwell in Your holy hill?
15.2: He who walks uprightly, and does righteousness, and speaks truth in his heart;
15.3: he who does not slander with the tongue and does no evil to his neighbor, nor bears a reproach against his friend;
15.4: in whose eyes a vile person is despised, but who honors those who fear the Lord; he who swears to avoid evil and does not change;
15.5: he who does not put his money out to usury, nor take a bribe against the innocent. He who does these things will never be moved.

16.1: Preserve me, O God, for in You I take refuge.
16.2: I have said to the Lord, “You are my Lord; my welfare has no existence outside of You.”
16.3: For the holy ones who are in the land, they are the majestic ones; in them is all my delight.
16.4: Those who chase after other gods, their sorrows will be multiplied; their drink offerings of blood I will not offer, nor lift their names on my lips.
16.5: The Lord is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup; You support my lot.
16.6: The lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; yes, an inheritance is beautiful for me.
16.7: I will bless the Lord who has given me counsel; my affections also instruct me in the night seasons.
16.8: I have set the Lord always before me; because He is at my right hand, I will not be moved.
16.9: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoices; my flesh also will rest in security.
16.10: For You will not leave my soul in Sheol, nor will You suffer Your godly one to see corruption.
16.11: You will make known to me the path of life; in Your presence is fullness of joy; at Your right hand there are pleasures for evermore.

17.1: Hear a just cause, O Lord, attend to my cry; give ear to my prayer that is not spoken from deceitful lips.
17.2: May my sentence go out from Your presence; may Your eyes see rightly.
17.3: You have examined my heart; You have visited me in the night; You have tried me and found nothing; I have purposed that my mouth will not transgress.
17.4: Concerning the works of men, by the word of Your lips I have avoided the paths of the violent,
17.5: placing my steps in Your paths, that my footsteps do not slip.
17.6: I called on You, for You will answer me, O God; incline Your ear to me, and hear my speech.
17.7: Show marvelously Your lovingkindness, O Deliverer of those who seek refuge by Your right hand from those who arise in opposition.
17.8: Keep me as the apple of Your eye; hide me under the shadow of Your wings,
17.9: from the wicked who bring ruin to me, from my deadly enemies who surround me.
17.10: They close their hard hearts; with their mouth they speak proudly.
17.11: They have now encircled us in our steps; they have set their eyes to bend down to the earth;
17.12: it is like a lion that is anxious to rip its prey, and as a young lion lurking in secrecy.
17.13: Arise, O Lord! Confront him, cast him down! Deliver my soul from the wicked by Your sword,
17.14: from men by Your hand, O Lord, from men of the world whose portion is in this life. You fill their belly with Your treasure; they are satisfied with children, and they leave their abundance to their infants.
17.15: As for me, I will see Your face in righteousness; I will be satisfied when I awake with Your likeness.

18.1: I love You, O Lord, my strength.
18.2: The Lord is my pillar, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my rock, in whom I take refuge; my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower.
18.3: I will call on the Lord, who is worthy to be praised, and I will be saved from my enemies.
18.4: The cords of death encircled me, and the torrents of destruction terrified me.
18.5: The cords of Sheol surrounded me; the snares of death confronted me.
18.6: In my distress I called on the Lord, and cried for help to my God; He heard my voice from His temple, and my cry for help came before Him to His ears.
18.7: Then the earth shook and quaked; the foundations of the hills also moved; they reeled because His anger burned.
18.8: Smoke went up out of His nostrils, and fire from His mouth devoured; coals were kindled by it.
18.9: He bent the heavens and came down, and darkness was under His feet.
18.10: He rode on a cherub, and flew; He flew swiftly on the wings of the wind.
18.11: He made darkness His secret place; His pavilion was surrounding Him, dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.
18.12: At the brightness before Him His thick clouds passed by, hailstones and coals of fire.
18.13: The Lord also thundered in the heavens, and the Most High gave His voice, hailstones and coals of fire.
18.14: He sent out His arrows and scattered them, and He shot out lightning and distressed them.
18.15: Then the channels of waters appeared, and the foundations of the world were discovered at Your rebuke, O Lord, at the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.
18.16: He sent from above, He took me; He drew me out of many waters.
18.17: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from those who hated me, for they were too strong for me.
18.18: They confronted me in the day of my calamity, but the Lord was my support.
18.19: He also brought me forth into a large place; He delivered me because He delighted in me.
18.20: The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands He has repaid me.
18.21: For I have kept the ways of the Lord, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
18.22: For all His judgments were before me, and I did not put away His statutes from me.
18.23: I was also upright before Him, and I kept myself from my iniquity.
18.24: Therefore the Lord has repaid me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in His view.
18.25: With the merciful You will show Yourself merciful; with the blameless man You will show Yourself blameless;
18.26: with the pure You will show Yourself pure; and with the crooked You will show Yourself crooked.
18.27: For You will save the afflicted people, but will bring down prideful eyes.
18.28: For You will cause my lamp to shine; the Lord my God will enlighten my darkness.
18.29: For by You I can run through a troop, and by my God I can leap a wall.
18.30: As for God, His way has integrity; the word of the Lord is proven; He is a shield to all those who take refuge in Him.
18.31: For who is God except the Lord? Or who is a rock besides our God?
18.32: It is God who clothes me with strength, and gives my way integrity.
18.33: He makes my feet like the feet of a deer, and causes me to stand on my high places.
18.34: He trains my hands for war, so that my arms bend a bow of bronze.
18.35: You have given me the shield of Your salvation, and Your right hand has held me up, and Your gentleness has made me great.
18.36: You have lengthened my stride under me, so that my feet did not slip.
18.37: I pursued my enemies and overtook them; I did not return until they were destroyed.
18.38: I wounded them, and they were not able to rise; they are fallen under my feet.
18.39: For You clothed me with strength for the battle; You subdued under me those who rose up against me.
18.40: You gave me the necks of my enemies, and I destroyed those who hate me.
18.41: They cried for help, but there was none to save them; even to the Lord, but He did not answer them.
18.42: Then I beat them small as the dust before the wind; I cast them out as the dirt in the streets.
18.43: You have delivered me from the hostilities of the people, and You have made me the head of nations; a people whom I have not known serve me.
18.44: At hearing a report, they obey me; foreigners come cringing to me.
18.45: Foreigners fade away, and come quaking out of their prisons.
18.46: The Lord lives! And blessed be my Rock! May the God of my salvation be exalted.
18.47: It is God who avenges me and subdues the people under me;
18.48: He delivers me from my enemies. You lift me up above those who rise up against me; You have delivered me from the violent man.
18.49: Therefore I will give thanks to You, O Lord, among the nations, and sing praises to Your name.
18.50: He gives great deliverance to His king, and shows lovingkindness to His anointed, to David and to his descendants for evermore.

19.1: The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament shows His handiwork.
19.2: Day unto day utters speech, and night unto night declares knowledge.
19.3: There is no speech and there are no words; their voice is not heard.
19.4: Their line has gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them has He set a tent for the sun,
19.5: which is like a bridegroom coming out of his chamber; it rejoices as a strong man to run a race.
19.6: Its going forth is from one end of the heavens, and its circuit extends to the other end, and there is nothing hidden from its heat.
19.7: The law of the Lord is perfect, converting the soul; the testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple;
19.8: the statutes of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart; the commandment of the Lord is pure, enlightening the eyes;
19.9: the fear of the Lord is clean, enduring forever; the judgments of the Lord are true and righteous altogether.
19.10: More to be desired are they than gold, yes, than much fine gold; sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.
19.11: Moreover by them is Your servant warned, and by keeping them comes great reward.
19.12: Who can understand his errors? Cleanse me from secret faults.
19.13: Keep back Your servant also from presumptuous sins; may they not rule over me. Then I will be upright and innocent from great transgression.
19.14: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in Your sight, O Lord, my strength and my Redeemer.

20.1: May the Lord answer you in the day of trouble; may the name of the God of Jacob defend you;
20.2: may He send you help from the sanctuary, and strengthen you from Zion;
20.3: may He remember all your offerings, and accept your burnt offering. Selah
20.4: May He grant you according to your own heart, and fulfill all your counsel.
20.5: We will rejoice in your salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners; may the Lord fulfill all your petitions.
20.6: Now I know that the Lord saves His anointed; He will answer him from His holy heaven with the saving strength of His right hand.
20.7: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses, but we will remember the name of the Lord our God.
20.8: They are brought down and fallen, but we arise and stand upright.
20.9: Save, Lord! May the King answer us when we call.

21.1: The king will rejoice in Your strength, O Lord, and in Your salvation how greatly will he rejoice!
21.2: You have given him his heart’s desire, and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah
21.3: For You meet him with the blessings of goodness; You set a crown of pure gold on his head.
21.4: He asked life of You, and You gave it him, length of days forever and ever.
21.5: His glory is great in Your salvation; honor and majesty You set on him.
21.6: For You place blessings on him forever; You make him rejoice with gladness with Your presence.
21.7: For the king trusts in the Lord, and by the lovingkindness of the Most High he will not be moved.
21.8: Your hand will find out all Your enemies; Your right hand will find out those who hate You.
21.9: You will make them as a fiery oven in the time of Your appearance; the Lord will swallow them up in His wrath, and fire will devour them.
21.10: You will destroy their offspring from the earth, and their descendants from among the children of men.
21.11: For they intended evil against You; they devised evil thoughts they will not be able to accomplish.
21.12: For You will make them turn their back, when You aim with Your bowstrings against their face.
21.13: Be exalted, Lord, by Your strength; may we sing and make music to Your might.

22.1: My God, my God, why have You forsaken me? Why are You so far from delivering me, and from my roaring words of distress?
22.2: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but You do not answer; and at night, but I have no rest.
22.3: But You are holy, O You who inhabits the praises of Israel.
22.4: Our fathers trusted in You; they trusted, and You did deliver them.
22.5: They cried to You and were delivered; they trusted in You and were not put to shame.
22.6: But I am a worm, and not a man; a reproach of men and despised by the people.
22.7: All who see me laugh me to scorn; they sneer with the lip, they shake the head, saying,
22.8: “Trust in the Lord, let Him deliver him; let Him rescue him, seeing He delights in him.”
22.9: But You are He who took me out of the womb; You caused me to trust while I was on my mother’s breasts.
22.10: I was cast on You from birth; You are my God from my mother’s womb.
22.11: Be not far from me for trouble is near, for there is none to help.
22.12: Many bulls encircle me; strong bulls of Bashan surround me.
22.13: They open their mouths against me, as a preying and roaring lion.
22.14: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint; my heart is like wax; it is melted inside my body.
22.15: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaves to my jaws; and You have set me toward the dust of death.
22.16: For dogs have encompassed me; the assembly of the wicked has enclosed me; like a lion they pin my hands and my feet;
22.17: I can count all my bones; they look and stare on me.
22.18: They part my garments among them and cast lots for my clothes.
22.19: But do not be far from me, O Lord; O my Help, hasten to my aid.
22.20: Rescue my soul from the sword, my only life from the power of the dog.
22.21: Save me from the lion’s mouth, and from the horns of the wild ox, answer me!
22.22: I will declare Your name to my community; in the midst of the congregation I will praise You.
22.23: You who fear the Lord, praise Him; all you descendants of Jacob, glorify Him, and stand in awe of Him, all you descendants of Israel.
22.24: For He has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; nor has He hid His face from him; but when he cried to Him, He heard.
22.25: From You my praise will be in the great congregation; I will pay my vows before those who fear Him.
22.26: The meek will eat and be satisfied; those who seek Him will praise the Lord. May your hearts live forever.
22.27: All the ends of the world will remember and turn to the Lord, and all the families of the nations will worship before You.
22.28: For kingship belongs to the Lord, and He rules among the nations.
22.29: All the prosperous ones of the earth will eat and worship; all who go down to the dust will bow before Him, even he who cannot keep his own soul alive.
22.30: Posterity will serve Him; it will be told to generations about the Lord;
22.31: they will come and declare His righteousness to a people yet to be born, that He has acted.

23.1: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
23.2: He makes me lie down in green pastures; He leads me beside still waters.
23.3: He restores my soul; He leads me in paths of righteousness for His name’s sake.
23.4: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for You are with me; Your rod and Your staff, they comfort me.
23.5: You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies; You anoint my head with oil; my cup runs over.
23.6: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever.

24.1: The earth belongs to the Lord, and its fullness, the world, and those who dwell in it.
24.2: For He has founded it on the seas, and established it on the floods.
24.3: Who may ascend the hill of the Lord? Who may stand in His holy place?
24.4: He who has clean hands and a pure heart; who has not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.
24.5: He will receive the blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
24.6: This is Jacob, the generation of those who seek Him, who seek Your face. Selah
24.7: Lift up your heads, O you gates; and be lifted up, you everlasting doors, that the King of glory may enter.
24.8: Who is this King of glory? The Lord strong and mighty, the Lord mighty in battle.
24.9: Lift up your heads, O you gates; lift up, you everlasting doors, that the King of glory may enter.
24.10: Who is He—this King of glory? The Lord of Hosts, He is the King of glory. Selah

25.1: To You, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
25.2: O my God, I trust in You; may I not be ashamed; may my enemies not triumph over me.
25.3: Yes, let none who wait on You be ashamed; let them be ashamed who transgress without cause.
25.4: Make me to know Your ways, O Lord; teach me Your paths.
25.5: Lead me in Your truth and teach me, for You are the God of my salvation; on You I wait all the day.
25.6: Remember Your mercies, O Lord, and Your lovingkindness, for they are from old.
25.7: Do not remember the sins of my youth or my transgressions; according to Your lovingkindness remember me, on account of Your goodness, O Lord.
25.8: Good and upright is the Lord; therefore He will teach sinners in the way.
25.9: The meek will He guide in judgment, and the meek He will teach His way.
25.10: All the paths of the Lord are lovingkindness and truth, for those who keep His covenant and His testimonies.
25.11: For Your name’s sake, O Lord, pardon my iniquity, for it is great.
25.12: Who is the man who fears the Lord? He will teach him in the way He should choose.
25.13: He will dwell at ease, and his descendants will inherit the land.
25.14: The counsel of the Lord is with those who fear him, and He will make His covenant known to them.
25.15: My eyes are ever toward the Lord, for He will lead my feet from the net.
25.16: Turn to me, and be gracious to me, for I am isolated and afflicted.
25.17: The troubles of my heart are enlarged; bring me out of my distresses.
25.18: Look on my pain and misery, and forgive all my sins.
25.19: Consider my enemies, for they are many, and they hate me with violent hatred.
25.20: Watch over my life, and deliver me! Let me not suffer shame, for I seek refuge in You.
25.21: Truth and integrity will preserve me while I wait for You.
25.22: Redeem Israel, O God, out of all their troubles.

26.1: Judge me, O Lord, for I have walked in my integrity. I have trusted in the Lord; I will not slip.
26.2: Examine me, O Lord, and test me; try my affections and my heart.
26.3: For Your lovingkindness is before my eyes, and I have walked in Your truth.
26.4: I have not sat with the worthless, nor will I go with hypocrites.
26.5: I have hated the congregation of evildoers, and will not sit with the wicked.
26.6: I will wash my hands in innocence; thus I will go around Your altar, O Lord,
26.7: that I may proclaim with the voice of thanksgiving, and tell of all Your wondrous works.
26.8: Lord, I have loved the refuge of Your house, and the place where Your honor dwells.
26.9: Do not gather my soul with sinners, nor my life with murderers,
26.10: in whose hands is wickedness, and their right hand is full of bribes.
26.11: But as for me, I will walk in my integrity; redeem me and be gracious to me.
26.12: My foot stands in an even place; with the congregations I will bless the Lord.

27.1: The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom will I fear? The Lord is the strength of my life; of whom will I be afraid?
27.2: When the wicked came against me to eat my flesh— my enemies and my foes— they stumbled and fell.
27.3: Though an army should encamp against me, my heart will not fear; though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.
27.4: One thing I have asked from the Lord, that will I seek after— for me to dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to see the beauty of the Lord, and to inquire in His temple.
27.5: For in the time of trouble He will hide me in His pavilion; in the shelter of His tabernacle He will hide me; He will set me up on a rock.
27.6: Now my head will be lifted up above my enemies encircling me; therefore I will offer sacrifices of joy in His tabernacle; I will sing, yes, I will sing praises to the Lord.
27.7: Hear, O Lord, when I cry with my voice! Be gracious to me and answer me.
27.8: When You said, “Seek My face,” my heart said to You, “Your face, Lord, I will seek.”
27.9: Do not hide Your face far from me; do not thrust Your servant away in anger; You have been my help. Do not leave me nor forsake me, O God of my salvation.
27.10: If my father and my mother forsake me, then the Lord will take me in.
27.11: Teach me Your way, O Lord, and lead me in an upright path, because of my enemies.
27.12: Do not deliver me to the will of my enemies; for false witnesses have risen against me, and they breathe out violence.
27.13: I believe I will see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.
27.14: Wait on the Lord; be strong, and may your heart be stout; wait on the Lord.

28.1: To You, O Lord, will I cry; my Rock, do not be silent to me; lest if You were silent to me, then I would become like those who go down to the pit.
28.2: Hear the voice of my supplications when I cry to You, when I lift up my hands toward Your most holy place.
28.3: Do not draw me away with the wicked and with the workers of iniquity, who speak peace to their neighbors, but mischief is in their hearts.
28.4: Give them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavors; give them according to the work of their hands; return to them what they deserve.
28.5: Because they do not regard the works of the Lord, nor the work of His hands, He will destroy them and not build them up.
28.6: Blessed be the Lord, because He has heard the voice of my supplications.
28.7: The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in Him, and I was helped; therefore my heart rejoices, and with my song I will thank Him.
28.8: The Lord is the strength of His people, and He is the saving strength of His anointed.
28.9: Save Your people, and bless Your inheritance; feed them and lift them up forever.

29.1: Give to the Lord, you heavenly beings, give to the Lord glory and strength.
29.2: Give to the Lord the glory of His name; worship the Lord in holy splendor.
29.3: The voice of the Lord is over the waters; the God of glory thunders; the Lord is over many waters.
29.4: The voice of the Lord sounds with strength; the voice of the Lord—with majesty.
29.5: The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars; the Lord breaks the cedars of Lebanon.
29.6: He makes them skip like a calf, Lebanon and Sirion like a wild ox.
29.7: The voice of the Lord flashes like flames of fire.
29.8: The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness; the Lord shakes the Wilderness of Kadesh.
29.9: The voice of the Lord makes the deer to give birth, and strips the forests bare; and in His temple everyone says, “Glory!”
29.10: The Lord sits enthroned above the flood, the Lord sits as King forever.
29.11: The Lord will give strength to His people; the Lord will bless His people with peace.

30.1: I will extol You, O Lord, for You have drawn me up, and have not caused my foes to rejoice over me.
30.2: O Lord my God, I cried to You, and You healed me.
30.3: O Lord, You have brought up my soul from the grave; You have kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
30.4: Sing to the Lord, O you saints of His, and give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness.
30.5: For His anger endures but a moment, in His favor is life; weeping may endure for a night, but joy comes in the morning.
30.6: In my prosperity I said, “I will never be moved.”
30.7: Lord, by Your favor You had set me strong as a mountain; You hid Your face, and I was terrified.
30.8: I cried to You, O Lord, and to the Lord I made supplication:
30.9: “What profit is there in my death, if I go down to the pit? Will the dust give You thanks? Will it declare Your truth?
30.10: Hear, O Lord, and be gracious to me; Lord, be my helper.”
30.11: For You have turned my mourning into dancing; You have put off my sackcloth and girded me with gladness,
30.12: so that my glory may sing praise to You and not be silent. O Lord my God, I will give thanks to You forever.

31.1: In You, O Lord, do I seek refuge; may I never be ashamed; deliver me in Your righteousness.
31.2: Incline Your ear to me; deliver me speedily; be my strong rock, a strong fortress to save me.
31.3: For You are my rock and my fortress; for Your name’s sake lead me and guide me.
31.4: Lead me out of the net that they have hidden for me, for You are my strength.
31.5: Into Your hand I commit my spirit; You have redeemed me, O Lord, God of truth.
31.6: I have hated those who regard worthless vanity, but I trust in the Lord.
31.7: I will be glad and rejoice in Your lovingkindness, for You have seen my trouble; You have known my soul in adversities,
31.8: and have not delivered me up into the hand of the enemy; You have set my feet in a broad place.
31.9: Be gracious to me, O Lord, for I am in trouble; my eye wastes away with grief, yes, my soul and my body.
31.10: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing; my strength fails because of my iniquity, and my bones waste away.
31.11: I became a reproach among all my enemies, but especially among my neighbors, and a dread to my acquaintances; those who saw me outside fled from me.
31.12: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind; I am like a broken vessel.
31.13: For I have heard the slander of many; fear was on every side; while they took counsel together against me, they planned to take away my life.
31.14: But I trusted in You, O Lord; I said, “You are my God.”
31.15: My times are in Your hand; deliver me from the hand of my enemies and my pursuers.
31.16: Make Your face to shine on Your servant; save me by Your lovingkindness.
31.17: Do not let me be ashamed, O Lord, for I have called on You; let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.
31.18: Let the lying lips be put to silence, who speak arrogantly in pride and contempt against the righteous.
31.19: Oh, how great is Your goodness, which You have laid up for those who fear You, which You have done for those seeking refuge in You before people!
31.20: You will hide them in the secret of Your presence from conspirators; You will keep them secretly in a shelter from the strife of tongues.
31.21: Blessed be the Lord, for He has shown me His marvelous lovingkindness in a fortified city.
31.22: For I said in my haste, “I am cut off from before Your eyes.” Nevertheless You heard the voice of my supplications when I cried to You.
31.23: Oh, love the Lord, all you His saints, for the Lord preserves the faithful, but amply repays the one who acts in pride.
31.24: Be strong, and He will strengthen your heart, all you who wait for the Lord.

32.1: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
32.2: Blessed is the man against whom the Lord does not count iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
32.3: When I kept silent, my bones wasted away through my groaning all day long.
32.4: For day and night Your hand was heavy on me; my strength was changed into the drought of summer. Selah
32.5: I acknowledged my sin to You, and my iniquity I did not conceal. I said, “I will confess my transgressions to the Lord,” and You forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah
32.6: For this cause everyone who is godly will pray to You in a time when You may be found; surely in the floods of great waters they will not reach him.
32.7: You are my hiding place; You will preserve me from trouble; You will surround me with shouts of deliverance. Selah
32.8: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with my eye on you.
32.9: Do not be as the horse or as the mule that are without understanding, that must be restrained with bit and bridle, or they will not come near you.
32.10: Many sorrows come to the wicked, but lovingkindness will surround the man who trusts in the Lord.
32.11: Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, you righteous one; and shout for joy, all you who are upright in heart!

33.1: Rejoice in the Lord, O you righteous, for praise is fitting for the upright.
33.2: Give thanks to the Lord with the harp; make music to Him with an instrument of ten strings.
33.3: Sing to Him a new song; play an instrument skillfully with a joyful shout.
33.4: For the word of the Lord is upright, and all His work is done in truth.
33.5: He loves righteousness and justice; the earth is full of the lovingkindness of the Lord.
33.6: By the word of the Lord the heavens were made, and all their host by the breath of His mouth.
33.7: He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap; He puts the depths in storehouses.
33.8: Let all the earth fear the Lord; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.
33.9: For He spoke, and it was done; He commanded, and it stood fast.
33.10: The Lord frustrates the counsel of the nations; He restrains the purposes of the people.
33.11: The counsel of the Lord stands forever, the purposes of His heart to all generations.
33.12: Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord, the people whom He has chosen as His inheritance.
33.13: The Lord looks from heaven; He sees all the sons of men.
33.14: From the place of His habitation He gazes on all the inhabitants of the earth;
33.15: He fashions their hearts alike; He considers all their works.
33.16: No king is saved by a great army; a mighty man is not delivered by great strength.
33.17: A horse is a vain hope for safety; it will not deliver by its great strength.
33.18: The eye of the Lord is on those who fear Him, on those who hope in His lovingkindness,
33.19: to deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.
33.20: Our soul waits for the Lord; He is our help and our shield.
33.21: For our heart will rejoice in Him, because we have trusted in His holy name.
33.22: Let Your lovingkindness, O Lord, be on us, just as we hope in You.

34.1: I will bless the Lord at all times; His praise will continually be in my mouth.
34.2: My soul will make its boast in the Lord; the humble will hear of it and be glad.
34.3: Oh, magnify the Lord with me, and let us exalt His name together.
34.4: I sought the Lord, and He answered me, and delivered me from all my fears.
34.5: They looked to Him and became radiant, and their faces are not ashamed.
34.6: This poor man cried, and the Lord heard, and saved him out of all his troubles.
34.7: The angel of the Lord camps around those who fear Him, and delivers them.
34.8: Oh, taste and see that the Lord is good; blessed is the man who takes refuge in Him.
34.9: Oh, fear the Lord, you His saints; for the ones who fear Him will not be in need.
34.10: The young lions are in want and suffer hunger, but the ones who seek the Lord will not lack any good thing.
34.11: Come, you children, listen to me; I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
34.12: Who is the man who desires life, and loves a long life in order to see good?
34.13: Keep your tongue from evil, and your lips from speaking deceit.
34.14: Turn away from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.
34.15: The eyes of the Lord are on the righteous, and His ears are open to their cry.
34.16: The face of the Lord is against the ones doing evil, to cut off the memory of them from the earth.
34.17: The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears, and delivers them out of all their troubles.
34.18: The Lord is near to the broken-hearted, and saves the contrite of spirit.
34.19: Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the Lord delivers him out of them all.
34.20: A righteous one keeps all his bones; not one of them is broken.
34.21: Evil will slay the wicked, and those who hate the righteous will be condemned.
34.22: The Lord redeems the life of His servants, and all who take refuge in Him will not be punished.

35.1: Plead my cause, O Lord, with my adversaries; fight those who fight me.
35.2: Take hold of the large shield and small shield, and rise up for my help.
35.3: Draw the spear and javelin against those who pursue me. Say to my soul, “I am Your salvation.”
35.4: May those who seek my life be ashamed and humiliated; may those who plan my injury be turned back and put to shame.
35.5: May they be as chaff before the wind, and may the angel of the Lord cast them down.
35.6: May their way be dark and slippery, and may the angel of the Lord pursue them.
35.7: For without cause they have hidden their net for me in a pit, which they have dug without cause for my soul.
35.8: Let destruction come on him without warning, and let the net that he hid ensnare him; let him fall into it, to his destruction.
35.9: My soul will be joyful in the Lord; it will rejoice in His salvation.
35.10: All my bones will say, “Lord, who is like You, who delivers the poor from a stronger one, the poor and the needy from the one who robs them?”
35.11: Witnesses intent on violence rose up; they accused me of things I knew nothing about.
35.12: They rewarded me evil for good, the bereavement of my soul.
35.13: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth; I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returns to my own heart.
35.14: I paced as though he were my friend or brother; I bowed down lamenting, as one who mourns for a mother.
35.15: But in my adversity they rejoiced and gathered together; assailants gathered together against me, though I was unaware; they tore me apart and did not stop;
35.16: with hypocritical mockers in feasts, they gnashed on me with their teeth.
35.17: Lord, how long will You look on? Rescue my soul from their destructions, my life from the lions.
35.18: I will give You thanks in the great congregation; I will praise You among a mighty people.
35.19: May my deceitful enemies not rejoice over me; nor may those who hate me without cause wink with their eye.
35.20: For they do not speak peace, but they devise deceitful matters against the restful ones in the land.
35.21: They opened their mouth wide against me, and said, “Aha, aha, our eye has seen it.”
35.22: This You have seen, O Lord; do not be silent; O Lord, be not far from me.
35.23: Rouse Yourself and awake for my judgment, for my cause, my God and my Lord.
35.24: Judge me, O Lord my God, according to Your righteousness, and may they not rejoice over me.
35.25: May they not say in their hearts, “Ah, we have our soul’s desire.” May they not say, “We have swallowed him up.”
35.26: May those who rejoice at my harm be ashamed and altogether put to shame; may they be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves against me.
35.27: May those who favor my righteous cause shout for joy and be glad; may they say continually, “The Lord be magnified, who delights in the peace of His servant.”
35.28: My tongue will speak of Your righteousness and of Your praise all the day long.

36.1: An oracle within my heart about the transgression of the wicked: There is no fear of God before their eyes.
36.2: For they flatter themselves in their own eyes, that their iniquity cannot be found out and hated.
36.3: The words of their mouth are wickedness and deceit; they have ceased to be wise and to do good.
36.4: They devise mischief on their bed; they set themselves on a path that is not good; they do not reject evil.
36.5: Your mercy, O Lord, is in the heavens, and Your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
36.6: Your righteousness is like the great mountains, Your judgments like the great deep; O Lord, You preserve man and beast.
36.7: How excellent is Your lovingkindness, O God! Therefore mankind seeks refuge in the shadow of Your wings.
36.8: They will drink their fill from the abundance of Your house, and You will cause them to drink from the river of Your pleasures.
36.9: For with You is the fountain of life; in Your light we see light.
36.10: Oh, continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You, and Your righteousness to the upright in heart.
36.11: Do not let the foot of the arrogant come against me, and do not let the hand of the wicked cause me to wander.
36.12: There the workers of iniquity have fallen; they are cast down and not able to rise.

37.1: Do not fret because of evildoers, nor be jealous of those who do injustice.
37.2: For they will quickly wither like the grass, and fade like the green herbs.
37.3: Trust in the Lord, and do good; dwell in the land, and practice faithfulness.
37.4: Delight yourself in the Lord, and He will give you the desires of your heart.
37.5: Commit your way to the Lord; trust also in Him, and He will bring it to pass.
37.6: He will bring forth your righteousness as the light, and your judgment as the noonday.
37.7: Rest in the Lord, and wait patiently for Him; do not fret because of those who prosper in their way, because of those who make wicked schemes.
37.8: Let go of anger, and forsake wrath; do not fret—it surely leads to evil deeds.
37.9: For evildoers will be cut off, but those who hope in the Lord will inherit the earth.
37.10: For yet a little while, and the wicked will not be; you will look diligently for their place, and it will not be.
37.11: But the meek will inherit the earth, and will delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
37.12: The wicked plot against the righteous, and grind their teeth against them.
37.13: The Lord will laugh at him, for He sees that his day is coming.
37.14: The wicked have drawn out the sword and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay those on the upright path.
37.15: Their sword will enter into their own heart, and their bows will be broken.
37.16: Better is a little that the righteous has than the abundance of many wicked.
37.17: For the arms of the wicked will be broken, but the Lord supports the righteous.
37.18: The Lord knows the days of people of integrity, and their inheritance will be forever.
37.19: They will not be ashamed in the evil time, and in the days of famine they will be satisfied.
37.20: But the wicked will perish, and the enemies of the Lord will be like the glory of pastures; they will waste away, in smoke they will waste away.
37.21: The wicked borrows and does not repay, but the righteous is gracious and gives.
37.22: For those who are blessed of Him will inherit the earth, but those who are cursed of Him will be cut off.
37.23: The steps of a man are made firm by the Lord; He delights in his way.
37.24: Though he falls, he will not be hurled down, for the Lord supports him with His hand.
37.25: I have been young, and now am old; yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken, nor their offspring begging bread.
37.26: The righteous are gracious and lend, and their offspring are a source of blessing.
37.27: Depart from evil and do good, and abide forevermore.
37.28: For the Lord loves justice, and does not forsake His saints; they are preserved forever, but the descendants of the wicked will be cut off.
37.29: The righteous will inherit the land, and dwell on it forever.
37.30: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom, and their tongue speaks justice.
37.31: The law of their God is in their heart; none of their steps will slip.
37.32: The wicked watch the righteous, and seek to kill them.
37.33: The Lord will not forsake them to their hand, nor condemn them when they are judged.
37.34: Hope in the Lord, and keep His way, and He will exalt you to inherit the land; when the wicked are cut off, you will see it.
37.35: I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a luxuriant tree.
37.36: Yet he passed away, and he was not; I sought him, but he could not be found.
37.37: Mark the blameless man, and consider the upright, for the end of that man is peace.
37.38: But the transgressors will be destroyed together; the end of the wicked is to be cut off.
37.39: But the salvation of the righteous is from the Lord; He is their refuge in the time of distress.
37.40: The Lord will help them and deliver them; He will deliver them from the wicked, and save them, because they take refuge in Him.

38.1: O Lord, do not rebuke me in Your wrath, nor chasten me in Your hot displeasure.
38.2: For Your arrows pierce me, and Your hand presses down on me.
38.3: There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your indignation, nor is there health in my bones because of my sin.
38.4: For my iniquities have passed over my head; as a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
38.5: My wounds grow foul and fester because of my foolishness.
38.6: I am bent, I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.
38.7: For my sides are filled with burning, and there is no soundness in my flesh.
38.8: I am numb and completely crushed; I have roared because of the groaning of my heart.
38.9: Lord, all my desire is before You, and my sighing is not hidden from You.
38.10: My heart throbs, my strength fails me; as for the light of my eyes, it also is gone from me.
38.11: My friends and my companions stand back because of my affliction, and those close to me stand at a distance.
38.12: The people who seek my life strike at me; those who seek my harm speak destruction, and plan treacheries all the day long.
38.13: But I, like a deaf man, did not hear; and like a dumb man, did not open my mouth.
38.14: Thus I was as a man who does not hear, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
38.15: For in You, O Lord, do I hope; You will answer, O Lord my God.
38.16: For I said, “Lest otherwise they should rejoice over me. When my foot slips, they magnify themselves against me.”
38.17: For I am ready to stumble, and my pain is continually before me.
38.18: For I will declare my iniquity; I am anxious because of my sin.
38.19: But my enemies are lively, and they are strong; and those who wrongfully hate me are many.
38.20: Those also who repay evil for good are my adversaries, because I pursue good.
38.21: Do not abandon me, O Lord; O my God, do not be far from me.
38.22: Make haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation.

39.1: I said, “I will take heed of my ways so that I do not sin with my tongue; I will keep my mouth muzzled while the wicked are before me.”
39.2: I was speechless in silence; I was silent to no avail, but my anguish was stirred up.
39.3: My heart was hot within me; while I was musing, the fire burned, then I spoke with my tongue:
39.4: “Lord, make me to know my end, and what is the measure of my days, that I may know how transient I am.
39.5: Indeed, You have made my days as a handbreadth, and my age is as nothing before You; indeed every man at his best is as a breath.” Selah
39.6: Surely every man walks in a mere shadow; surely he goes as a breath; he heaps up riches, and does not know who will gather them.
39.7: Now, Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in You.
39.8: Deliver me from all my transgressions; do not make me the reproach of the foolish.
39.9: I was speechless, I did not open my mouth, because You did it.
39.10: Remove Your blow from me; I am consumed by the hostility of Your hand.
39.11: When with rebukes You correct a man for iniquity, You consume like a moth what is dear to him; surely every man is vapor. Selah
39.12: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear to my cry; do not be silent at my tears, for I am a stranger with You, and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
39.13: Turn Your gaze of displeasure from me, that I may smile, before I go away and am no more.

40.1: I waited patiently for the Lord, and He turned to me, and heard my cry.
40.2: He also brought me up out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet on a rock, and established my steps.
40.3: He has put a new song in my mouth, even praise to our God; many will see it, and fear, and will trust in the Lord.
40.4: Blessed is the man who places trust in the Lord, but does not turn toward the proud, nor those falling away to falsehood.
40.5: O Lord my God, You have done many wonderful works, and Your thoughts toward us cannot be compared; if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.
40.6: Sacrifice and offering You did not desire; You have opened up my ears to listen. Burnt offering and sin offering You have not required.
40.7: Then I said, “Behold, I have come; in the scroll of the book it is written of me,
40.8: I delight to do Your will, O my God; Your law is within my inward parts.”
40.9: I have proclaimed righteousness in the great congregation; I have not held back my lips, O Lord, You know.
40.10: I have not hidden Your righteousness within my heart; I have declared Your faithfulness and Your salvation; I have not concealed Your lovingkindness and Your truth from the great congregation.
40.11: Do not withhold Your compassion from me, O Lord; may Your lovingkindness and Your truth always guard me.
40.12: For innumerable evils have surrounded me; my iniquities have overtaken me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of my head so that my heart fails me.
40.13: Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me; O Lord, make haste to help me.
40.14: May those seeking to snatch away my life be ashamed and confounded together; may those who desire my harm be driven backward and dishonored.
40.15: May those who say to me “Aha, aha!” be appalled on account of their shame.
40.16: May all those who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; may those who love Your salvation say continually, “The Lord is magnified.”
40.17: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinks about me. You are my help and my deliverer; do not delay, O my God.

41.1: Blessed are those who consider the poor; the Lord will deliver them in the day of trouble.
41.2: The Lord will preserve them and keep them alive, and they will be blessed on the earth, and You will not deliver them to the will of their enemies.
41.3: The Lord will sustain them on the sickbed; You will restore all his lying down in his illness.
41.4: I said, “Lord, be gracious to me; heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.”
41.5: My enemies speak evil of me: “When will he die, and his name perish?”
41.6: And if people come to see me, they speak insincerely; their heart gathers iniquity to itself, when they go outside, they tell it.
41.7: All who hate me whisper together against me; they devise harm against me.
41.8: “An evil disease clings to him. And now that he lies down, he will not rise up again.”
41.9: Yes, my own close friend, in whom I trusted, who ate of my bread, has lifted up the heel against me.
41.10: But You, O Lord, be gracious to me, and raise me up, that I may repay them.
41.11: By this I know that You favor me, because my enemy does not triumph over me.
41.12: As for me, You uphold me in my integrity, and set me before You forever.
41.13: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting and to everlasting. Amen and Amen.

42.1: As the deer pants after the water brooks, so my soul pants after You, O God.
42.2: My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When will I come and appear before God?
42.3: My tears have been my food day and night, while they always say to me, “Where is your God?”
42.4: When I remember these things, I pour out my soul within me. For I would travel with the throng of people; I proceeded with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and thanks, with a multitude making a pilgrimage.
42.5: Why are you cast down, O my soul? And why are you disquieted in me? Hope in God, for I will yet thank Him for the help of His presence.
42.6: O my God, my soul is cast down within me; therefore I will remember You from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermon, from the hill of Mizar.
42.7: Deep calls to deep at the noise of Your waterfalls; all Your waves and Your billows passed over me.
42.8: Yet the Lord will command His lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night His song will be with me, a prayer to the God of my life.
42.9: I will say to God, my rock, “Why have You forgotten me? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?”
42.10: With shattering in my bones, those harassing me reproach me, when they say to me every day, “Where is your God?”
42.11: Why, my soul, are you cast down? Why do you groan within me? Wait for God; I will yet thank Him, For He is my deliverance and my God.

43.1: Vindicate me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation; deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.
43.2: For You are the God of my refuge; why have You rejected me? Why do I walk about mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
43.3: Send out Your light and Your truth. Let them lead me; let them bring me to Your holy hill, and to Your dwelling place.
43.4: Then I will go to the altar of God, to the God of my joyful gladness; with the harp I will give thanks to You, O God, my God.
43.5: Why are you cast down, O my soul? And why are you disquieted within me? Hope in God; for I will yet give Him thanks, the salvation of my countenance and my God.

44.1: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us what work You did in their days, in the days of old:
44.2: how You drove out the nations with Your hand, and planted others instead; how You afflicted peoples, and sent them away.
44.3: For they did not take possession of the land by their own sword, nor did their own arm save them; but it was Your right hand, and Your arm, and the light of Your countenance, because You had favor on them.
44.4: You are my King, O God; command deliverances for Jacob.
44.5: Through You we will push down our opponents; through Your name we will trample those who rise up against us.
44.6: For I will not trust in my bow, nor will my sword save me.
44.7: But You have saved us from our opponents, and have put to shame those who hate us.
44.8: In God we boast all the day long, and give thanks to Your name forever. Selah
44.9: But You have rejected us and put us to shame, and do not go out with our armies.
44.10: You make us to turn back from the opponent, and those who hate us make us their spoil.
44.11: You have placed us like sheep for prey, and have scattered us among the nations.
44.12: You sell Your people for nothing, and do not increase Your wealth by their sale.
44.13: You make us a reproach to our neighbors, a scorn and a derision to those who surround us.
44.14: You make us a byword among the nations, a shaking of the head among the people.
44.15: All day long my reproach is before me, and the shame of my face covers me,
44.16: from the voice of him who reproaches and reviles, by reason of the enemy and avenger.
44.17: All this is come on us, yet we have not forgotten You, nor have we dealt falsely in Your covenant.
44.18: Our heart is not turned back, nor have our steps deviated from Your way,
44.19: though You have crushed us in the place of jackals, and covered us with the shadow of death.
44.20: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god,
44.21: would not God search this out? For He knows the secrets of the heart.
44.22: Yes, for Your sake we are killed all the day long; we are considered like sheep for the slaughter.
44.23: Awake; why do You sleep, O Lord? Arise; do not reject us forever.
44.24: Why do You hide Your face, and forget our affliction and our oppression?
44.25: For our soul is bowed down to the dust; our body cleaves to the earth.
44.26: Arise, be our help, and redeem us for the sake of Your lovingkindness.

45.1: My heart is overflowing with a good thought; I am speaking my works for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skilled scribe.
45.2: You are fairer than all the sons of men; favor is poured on your lips; therefore God has blessed you forever.
45.3: Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one, with your splendor and your majesty.
45.4: In your majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and your right hand will teach you awesome things.
45.5: Your arrows are sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies; peoples will fall under you.
45.6: Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; the scepter of Your kingdom is an upright scepter.
45.7: You love righteousness and hate wickedness; therefore God, your God, anointed you with the oil of gladness above your companions.
45.8: All your garments are fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia; from the ivory palaces stringed instruments make you glad.
45.9: Kings’ daughters are among your honorable women; at your right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.
45.10: Listen, O daughter, consider and incline your ear; forget your own people, and your father’s house,
45.11: and the king will desire your beauty. Since he is your lord, bow to him.
45.12: The daughter of Tyre will be there with a gift; even the rich among the people will entreat your favor.
45.13: The royal daughter is all glorious within her chamber; her clothing is plaited gold.
45.14: She shall be brought to the king in embroidered garments; the virgins, her companions who follow her, shall be brought to you.
45.15: With gladness and rejoicing they shall be brought; they shall enter into the king’s palace.
45.16: Your sons shall succeed your fathers; you will make them princes in all the land.
45.17: I will cause your name to be remembered in all generations; therefore the people will praise you forever and ever.

46.1: God is our refuge and strength, a well-proven help in trouble.
46.2: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;
46.3: though its waters roar and foam, though the mountains shake with its swelling. Selah
46.4: There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God, the holy dwelling place of the Most High.
46.5: God is in the midst of her; she will not be moved; God will help her in the early dawn.
46.6: The nations roared; the kingdoms were moved; He uttered His voice; the earth melted.
46.7: The Lord of Hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah
46.8: Come, see the works of the Lord, who makes desolations in the earth.
46.9: He makes wars cease to the end of the earth; He breaks the bow and cuts off the spear; He burns the chariot in the fire.
46.10: Be still and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.
46.11: The Lord of Hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah

47.1: Clap your hands, all you people! Shout to God with a joyful voice.
47.2: For the Lord Most High is awesome; He is a great King over all the earth.
47.3: He subdued peoples under us, and nations under our feet.
47.4: He chose our inheritance for us, the excellency of Jacob whom He loved. Selah
47.5: God went up with a shout, the Lord with the sound of a trumpet.
47.6: Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises to our King, sing praises.
47.7: For God is the King of all the earth; sing praises with understanding.
47.8: God reigns over the nations; God sits on His holy throne.
47.9: The princes of peoples are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham. For the shields of the earth belong to God; He is greatly exalted.

48.1: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, in His holy mountain.
48.2: Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth, is Mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.
48.3: God is known in her citadels as a refuge.
48.4: For the kings were assembled, they passed by together.
48.5: They saw it, and so they were astounded; they were alarmed, they hurried away.
48.6: Trembling seized them there, and pain like a woman in labor;
48.7: You break the ships of Tarshish with an east wind.
48.8: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of Hosts, in the city of our God; God will establish it forever. Selah
48.9: We have thought of Your lovingkindness, O God, in the midst of Your temple.
48.10: According to Your name, O God, so is Your praise to the ends of the earth; Your right hand is full of righteousness.
48.11: May Mount Zion rejoice, may the daughters of Judah be glad, because of Your judgments.
48.12: Walk about Zion, and go round about her; count her towers;
48.13: mark well her bulwarks; consider her citadels; that you may tell it to the generation following.
48.14: For this God is our God forever and ever; He will be our guide even to death.

49.1: Hear this, all you people; give ear, all you inhabitants of the world,
49.2: both low and high, rich and poor together.
49.3: My mouth will speak wisdom, and the meditation of my heart will be understanding.
49.4: I will incline my ear to a parable; I will expound my riddle with a harp.
49.5: Why should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my stalkers surrounds me?
49.6: Those who trust in their wealth, and boast in the multitude of their riches,
49.7: none of them can by any means redeem the other, nor give to God a ransom for anyone,
49.8: for the redemption of their souls is costly; even so people cease to exist forever,
49.9: making efforts to live eternally, and not see the pit.
49.10: For one sees that wise men die, together the fool and the brute perish, and leave their wealth to others.
49.11: Their graves become their perpetual homes, and their dwelling places to all generations, though they call their lands after their own names.
49.12: But a man does not abide in honor; mankind is like the beasts that come to ruin.
49.13: This is their way, it is their folly; yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah
49.14: Like sheep they are appointed for Sheol; Death shall be their shepherd; the upright shall rule over them in the morning, and their form shall waste away in Sheol, far from their dwelling.
49.15: But God shall redeem my soul from the power of Sheol, for He shall receive me. Selah
49.16: Do not fear when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased,
49.17: for he takes nothing away in death; his glory does not descend after him.
49.18: Though while he lives he blesses his soul— and men will praise you when you do well for yourself—
49.19: that soul will go to the generation of his fathers; they will never see light.
49.20: A man in honor, and yet without understanding, is like the animals that perish.

50.1: The Mighty One, God, is the Lord; He has spoken and summoned the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
50.2: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God has shined.
50.3: Our God will come, and will not keep silent; a fire consumes before Him, and a strong tempest is around Him.
50.4: He calls to the heavens above, and to the earth, that He may judge His people:
50.5: “Gather My faithful ones together to Me, those who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.”
50.6: The heavens will declare His righteousness, for God Himself is judge. Selah
50.7: “Hear, O My people, and I will speak, O Israel, and I will testify against you; I am God, even your God.
50.8: I will not reprove you for your sacrifices or for your burnt offerings that are continually before Me.
50.9: I will take no young bull out of your house, nor male goats out of your folds.
50.10: For every wild animal of the forest is Mine, and the cattle on a thousand hills.
50.11: I know every bird of the mountains, and the creatures that move in the field are Mine.
50.12: If I were hungry, I would not tell you; for the world is Mine, and all its fullness.
50.13: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
50.14: Sacrifice a thank offering to God, and pay your vows to the Most High,
50.15: and call on Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you will glorify Me.”
50.16: But to the wicked God says: “What right have you to declare My statutes, or take My covenant in your mouth?
50.17: You hate instruction, and cast My words behind you.
50.18: When you see a thief, you are pleased, and have a share in those who commit adultery.
50.19: You let loose your mouth to evil, and your tongue is bound to deceit.
50.20: You sit and speak against your brother; you accuse your own mother’s son.
50.21: These things have you done, and I kept silent; you thought that I was indeed like you; but I will reprove you and make a case before your eyes.
50.22: “Now consider this, you who forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver:
50.23: Whoever sacrifices a thank offering glorifies Me and makes a way; I will show him the salvation of God.”

51.1: Have mercy on me, O God, according to Your lovingkindness; according to the abundance of Your compassion, blot out my transgressions.
51.2: Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
51.3: For I acknowledge my transgressions, and my sin is ever before me.
51.4: Against You, You only, have I sinned, and done this evil in Your sight, so that You are justified when You speak, and You are blameless when You judge.
51.5: I was brought forth in iniquity, and in sin my mother conceived me.
51.6: You desire truth in the inward parts, and in the hidden part You make me to know wisdom.
51.7: Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean; wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
51.8: Make me to hear joy and gladness, that the bones that You have broken may rejoice.
51.9: Hide Your face from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.
51.10: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
51.11: Do not cast me away from Your presence, and do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.
51.12: Restore to me the joy of Your salvation, and uphold me with Your willing spirit.
51.13: Then I will teach transgressors Your ways, and sinners will return to You.
51.14: Deliver me from blood guiltiness, O God, God of my salvation, and my tongue will sing aloud of Your righteousness.
51.15: O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will declare Your praise.
51.16: For You do not desire sacrifice, or I would give it; You do not delight in burnt offering.
51.17: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a broken and a contrite heart, O God, You will not despise.
51.18: Do good to Zion in Your good pleasure; build the walls of Jerusalem.
51.19: Then You will be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering; then they will offer young bulls on Your altar.

52.1: Why do you boast in evil, O mighty man? The goodness of God endures continually.
52.2: Your tongue devises calamities, like a sharp razor, you worker of treachery.
52.3: You love evil more than good, and lying rather than speaking righteousness. Selah
52.4: You love all devouring words, O you deceitful tongue.
52.5: God will likewise break you down forever; He will snatch you away and pluck you from your home, and uproot you from the land of the living. Selah
52.6: The righteous also will see and fear, and will laugh in contempt,
52.7: “See, this is the man who did not make God his refuge, but trusted in the abundance of riches, and grew strong in his own wickedness.”
52.8: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God; I trust in the mercy of God forever and ever.
52.9: I will give thanks to You forever, because You have acted; and I will wait on Your name, for it is good before Your saints.

53.1: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.” They are corrupt, and have done abhorrent injustice; there is none who does good.
53.2: God looked down from heaven on the children of men, to see if there were any who have insight, who seek God.
53.3: Every one of them has turned aside; they are altogether corrupt; there is no one who does good, not even one.
53.4: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge, who eat up my people as they eat bread, and do not call on God?
53.5: There they were in fear, where there was nothing to fear, for God has scattered the bones of him who camps against you; you have put them to shame, because God has rejected them.
53.6: Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion! When God brings back the captivity of His people, Jacob will rejoice and Israel will be glad.

54.1: O God, save me by Your name, and judge me by Your strength.
54.2: O God, hear my prayer; give ear to the words of my mouth.
54.3: For strangers rise up against me, and formidable adversaries seek my life; they do not set God before them. Selah
54.4: God is my helper; the Lord is with those who support my life.
54.5: He will repay my enemies for their evil. In Your faithfulness, destroy them.
54.6: I will sacrifice a freewill offering to You; I will give thanks to Your name, O Lord, for it is good.
54.7: For He has delivered me out of all trouble; and my eye has looked down on my enemies.

55.1: Give ear to my prayer, O God, and do not hide Yourself from my supplication.
55.2: Attend to me, and answer me; I am restless in my complaint, and I murmur,
55.3: because of the voice of the enemy, because of the pressure of the wicked, for they cause trouble to drop on me, and in wrath they have animosity against me.
55.4: My heart is in pain within me, and the terrors of death have fallen on me.
55.5: Fear and trembling come into me, and horror has overwhelmed me.
55.6: I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove! For then I would fly away and be at rest.
55.7: Indeed, then I would wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah
55.8: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.”
55.9: Confuse, O Lord, divide their tongues, for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
