103.20: Bless the Lord, you His angels, who are mighty, and do His commands, and obey the voice of His word.
103.21: Bless the Lord, all you His hosts; you servants who do His pleasure.
103.22: Bless the Lord, all His works, in all places of His dominion. Bless the Lord, O my soul!

104.1: Bless the Lord, O my soul! O Lord my God, You are very great! You are clothed with honor and majesty,
104.2: covering Yourself with light as a garment, who stretches out the heavens like a tent curtain,
104.3: who lays the upper beams of His chambers on the waters above, who makes the clouds His chariot, who rides upon the wings of the wind,
104.4: who makes His angels as winds, His ministers a flaming fire.
104.5: You laid the earth on its foundations, so that it should never be moved.
104.6: You covered it with the deep as a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.
104.7: At Your rebuke they fled; at the sound of Your thunder they departed away.
104.8: The mountains rose up; the valleys went down to the place that You appointed them.
104.9: You set a boundary that they may not pass over, that they may not again cover the earth.
104.10: You send the springs to gush forth in the valleys, which flow between the hills.
104.11: They give drink to every animal of the field; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
104.12: By them the birds of the heavens have their habitation; they sing among the branches.
104.13: You water the mountains from Your lofty chamber; the earth is satisfied with the fruit of Your works.
104.14: You cause the grass to grow for the cattle and plants for the cultivation of man, that he may bring forth food from the earth
104.15: and wine that makes glad the heart of man, and oil that makes shine his face, and bread that strengthens his heart.
104.16: The trees of the Lord are well watered, the cedars of Lebanon that He has planted,
104.17: where the birds make their nests, where the stork has its home in the fir trees.
104.18: The high mountains are for the wild goats, and the rocks a refuge for the badgers.
104.19: He set the moon to mark the appointed seasons; the sun knows its time for going down.
104.20: You make darkness, and it is night, when all the animals of the forest go forth.
104.21: The young lions roar after their prey and seek their food from God.
104.22: When the sun arises, they gather themselves together and lay down in their dens.
104.23: Man goes forth to his work and to his labor until the evening.
104.24: O Lord, how manifold are Your works! With wisdom You have made them all; the earth is full of Your creatures—
104.25: so is this great and wide sea, which is full of innumerable creatures, living animals both small and great.
104.26: There go the ships, and there is Leviathan, which You have made to play in it.
104.27: These all wait upon You, that You may give them their food in due season.
104.28: When You give it to them, they gather it; when You open Your hand, they are filled with good food.
104.29: When You hide Your face, they are troubled; You take away their breath, and they die and return to their dust.
104.30: When You send forth Your Spirit, they are created, and You renew the surface of the ground.
104.31: May the glory of the Lord endure forever; may the Lord rejoice in His works.
104.32: He looks on the earth, and it trembles; He touches the mountains, and they smoke.
104.33: I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live; I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
104.34: May my meditation be sweet to Him, for I will be glad in the Lord.
104.35: Let sinners be consumed from the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless the Lord, O my soul! Praise the Lord!

105.1: Oh, give thanks unto the Lord; call upon His name; make known His deeds among the peoples.
105.2: Sing unto Him, sing praises unto Him; proclaim all His wondrous works.
105.3: Glory in His holy name; let the heart rejoice for those who seek the Lord.
105.4: Seek the Lord and His strength; seek His presence continuously.
105.5: Remember His marvelous works that He has done; His wonders and the judgments from His mouth,
105.6: O offspring of Abraham, His servant, O children of Jacob, His chosen ones.
105.7: He is the Lord our God; His judgments are in all the earth.
105.8: He remembers His covenant forever, the word that He commanded, to a thousand generations,
105.9: that covenant He made with Abraham, and His oath to Isaac,
105.10: and confirmed to Jacob as a decree, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
105.11: saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan as the portion of your inheritance.”
105.12: When they were but a few people in number, indeed, very few, and strangers in it,
105.13: when they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people,
105.14: He did not permit anyone to do them wrong; indeed, He reproved kings on their behalf,
105.15: saying, “Do not touch my anointed ones, and do no harm to my prophets.”
105.16: Moreover He called for a famine upon the land; He broke the whole supply of bread.
105.17: He sent a man before them, Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
105.18: They hurt his feet with fetters; his neck was put in an iron collar.
105.19: Until the time that his word came to pass, the word of the Lord tested him.
105.20: The king sent and released him; the ruler of the people let him go free.
105.21: He made Joseph lord of his house and ruler of all his possessions,
105.22: to imprison his princes at Joseph’s pleasure and to teach his elders wisdom.
105.23: Then Israel came into Egypt, and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
105.24: The Lord increased His people greatly and made them stronger than their enemies.
105.25: He turned their hearts to hate His people, to deal cleverly with His servants.
105.26: He sent Moses, His servant, and Aaron whom He had chosen.
105.27: They showed His signs among them and wonders in the land of Ham.
105.28: He sent darkness and made the land dark, and Moses and Aaron did not rebel against His word.
105.29: He turned their waters into blood and caused their fish to die.
105.30: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, even in the chambers of their kings.
105.31: He spoke, and there came swarms of flies and gnats in all their country.
105.32: He gave them hail for rain and flaming lightning in their land.
105.33: He struck their vines and their fig trees and shattered the trees of their country.
105.34: He spoke, and the locusts came, and caterpillars without number,
105.35: that devoured all the vegetation in their land, and ate all the fruit of their ground.
105.36: He struck down all the firstborn in their land, the first fruits of all their strength.
105.37: Then He brought them out with silver and gold, and no one among their tribes faltered.
105.38: Egypt was glad when they left, for the fear of Israel fell upon them.
105.39: He spread a cloud for a covering, and fire to give light in the night.
105.40: The people asked, and He brought quail, and satisfied them with abundant bread of heaven.
105.41: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the desert like a river.
105.42: For he recalled His holy promise to Abraham His servant.
105.43: He brought forth His people with joy, and His chosen ones with gladness,
105.44: and gave them the lands of the nations, and they took possession of the fruitful labor of the people,
105.45: that they might observe His statutes and keep His laws. Praise the Lord!

106.1: Praise the Lord! Oh, give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good, for His mercy endures forever.
106.2: Who can recount the mighty acts of the Lord or declare all His praise?
106.3: Blessed are those who keep justice and who do righteousness at all times.
106.4: Remember me, O Lord, when You give favor to Your people; visit me with Your deliverance,
106.5: that I may see the goodness over Your chosen ones, that I may rejoice in the gladness of Your nation, that I may glory with Your inheritance.
106.6: We have sinned with our fathers; we have committed iniquity; we have done wickedly.
106.7: Our fathers did not consider Your wonders in Egypt; they did not remember the greatness of Your mercy, but rebelled against Him at the sea, by the Red Sea.
106.8: Nevertheless He saved them for His name’s sake, that He might make His mighty power known.
106.9: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up, so He led them through the depths as through the wilderness.
106.10: He saved them from the hand of him who hated them and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
106.11: The waters covered their enemies; there was not one of them left.
106.12: Then they believed His words; they sang His praise.
106.13: But they soon forgot His works; they did not wait for His counsel,
106.14: but they lusted exceedingly in the wilderness and tested God in the desert.
106.15: He gave them their request, but He sent a wasting disease on them.
106.16: They envied in the camp Moses and Aaron, the holy priest of the Lord.
106.17: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan and engulfed those led by Abiram.
106.18: A fire broke out among their company; the flame burned up the wicked.
106.19: They made a calf at Horeb, and worshipped the molded image.
106.20: Thus they changed the glory of God for the image of an ox that eats grass.
106.21: They forgot God, their Deliverer, who had done great things in Egypt,
106.22: wondrous works in the land of Ham, and marvelous deeds by the Red Sea.
106.23: Therefore He said that He would destroy them, had not Moses, His chosen one, stood before Him to intercede, to turn away His wrath from destroying them.
106.24: Then they despised the pleasant land; they did not believe His promise,
106.25: but they grumbled in their tents, and did not listen to the voice of the Lord.
106.26: Therefore He lifted up His hand against them and swore to overthrow them in the wilderness,
106.27: and to overthrow their offspring among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.
106.28: They joined themselves to Baal of Peor and ate the sacrifices given for the dead.
106.29: Thus they provoked Him to anger with their acts, and a plague broke out upon them.
106.30: Then Phinehas stood up and interceded, and so the plague ceased.
106.31: That was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations forever.
106.32: They angered Him also at the waters of Meribah, so that Moses suffered because of them,
106.33: because they provoked his temper, so that he spoke impulsively with his lips.
106.34: They did not destroy the nations as the Lord commanded them,
106.35: but they mixed among the nations and learned their deeds;
106.36: they served their idols, which were a snare to them.
106.37: Yes, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons,
106.38: and poured out innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, and the land was polluted with blood.
106.39: Thus were they defiled by their acts and acted like whores with these actions.
106.40: Therefore the wrath of the Lord was kindled against His people, and He abhorred His own inheritance.
106.41: He gave them into the hand of the nations, and those who hated them ruled over them.
106.42: Their enemies also oppressed them, and Israel was brought into subjection under their powerful hand.
106.43: Many times He delivered them, but they were rebellious against Him with their counsel, and were afflicted for their iniquity.
106.44: Nevertheless, He regarded their affliction, when He heard their cry:
106.45: and He remembered on their behalf His covenant and relented according to the greatness of His mercies.
106.46: He made them pitied among all those who held them captive.
106.47: Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the nations, to give thanks unto Your holy name and to boast in Your praise.
106.48: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting, and let all the people say, “Amen!” Praise the Lord!

107.1: Oh, give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good, for His mercy endures forever!
107.2: Let the redeemed of the Lord speak out, whom He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy,
107.3: and gathered them from the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.
107.4: They wandered in the wilderness on a deserted path; they found no city to dwell in.
107.5: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
107.6: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and He delivered them out of their distresses.
107.7: He led them on a level road, that they might go to a city to live in.
107.8: Let them praise the Lord for His goodness and for His wonderful works to the people!
107.9: For He satisfies the longing soul and fills the hungry soul with goodness.
107.10: Some sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being prisoners in affliction and irons,
107.11: because they rebelled against the words of God and rejected the counsel of the Most High.
107.12: Therefore He brought down their hearts with hard labor; they fell down, and there was none to help.
107.13: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and He delivered them out of their distress.
107.14: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death and broke apart their bonds.
107.15: Let them praise the Lord for His goodness and for His wonderful works to the people!
107.16: For He has broken the gates of bronze and cut the bars of iron in two.
107.17: Some were fools because of their transgressions, and because of their iniquities they are afflicted.
107.18: They loathed all manner of food, and they drew near to the gates of death.
107.19: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and He saved them out of their distress.
107.20: He sent His word and healed them and delivered them from their destruction.
107.21: Let them praise the Lord for His goodness and for His wonderful works to the people!
107.22: And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving and declare His works with rejoicing.
107.23: Some went down to the sea in ships, to do business in the vast waters;
107.24: they saw the works of the Lord and His wonders in the deep water.
107.25: For He commands and raises the stormy wind, which lifts up the sea waves.
107.26: The sailors went up to the sky, they came down to the depths; their strength melted because of the great danger.
107.27: They reeled to and fro and staggered like drunken men, and were completely confused.
107.28: Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble, and He saved them out of their distress.
107.29: He made the storm calm, and the sea waves were still.
107.30: They were glad because the waters were quiet, so He brought them to their desired harbor.
107.31: Let them praise the Lord for His goodness and for His wonderful works to the people!
107.32: Let them exalt Him in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
107.33: He turns rivers into a desert, water springs into dry ground,
107.34: a fruitful land into salty wasteland, because of the wickedness of those living there.
107.35: He turns a wilderness into pools of water, a parched ground into springs of water.
107.36: There He makes the hungry dwell, and they prepare a city to live in;
107.37: they sow fields and plant vineyards, and yield a fruitful harvest.
107.38: He blesses them, so that they are greatly multiplied, and He does not let their livestock decrease.
107.39: But when they are diminished and brought down through oppression, affliction, and sorrow,
107.40: He pours contempt upon princes, and causes them to wander in a wilderness with no road;
107.41: yet He raises up the poor from affliction and cares for their families like flocks of sheep.
107.42: The righteous shall see it and rejoice, and all evil people shall stop their mouth.
107.43: Whoever is wise let him observe these things; let them consider the lovingkindness of the Lord.

108.1: O God, my heart is determined; I will sing and give praise with my whole heart.
108.2: Awake, O lyre and harp! I will awake at dawn!
108.3: I will praise you, O Lord, among the peoples, and I will sing praises unto You among the nations.
108.4: For Your mercy is great above the heavens; Your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
108.5: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens, may Your glory be above all the earth.
108.6: That Your beloved ones may be delivered, provide salvation with Your right hand and answer me.
108.7: God has spoken in His sanctuary: “I will triumph and will divide up Shechem and portion out the Valley of Sukkoth.
108.8: Gilead is Mine; Manasseh is Mine; Ephraim is My helmet; Judah is My royal scepter;
108.9: Moab is My washbasin; on Edom I throw My shoe; over Philistia I shout in triumph.”
108.10: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me into Edom?
108.11: Have You not rejected us, O God? You surely do not go out, O God, with our armies.
108.12: Grant us help against the foe, for the help of man is worthless.
108.13: Through God we shall be valiant, for He shall tread down our enemies.

109.1: Do not remain silent, O God of my praise!
109.2: For the mouth of the wicked and deceitful are opened against me; they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
109.3: They encircled me with words of hatred and fought against me without cause.
109.4: In return for my love they are my adversaries, but I give myself to prayer.
109.5: They have rewarded me evil for good and hatred for my love.
109.6: Set a wicked man against him, and let an accuser stand at his right hand.
109.7: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned, and let his prayer be reckoned as sin.
109.8: Let his days be few, and let another take his office.
109.9: Let his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.
109.10: Let his children be wandering beggars; let them seek their bread far from their desolate places.
109.11: Let the creditor seize all that he has; let the strangers plunder the fruit of his labor.
109.12: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him, neither let there be any to pity his fatherless children.
109.13: Let his posterity be cut off, and in the generation following let his name be blotted out.
109.14: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the Lord, and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
109.15: Let them be before the Lord continually, that the Lord may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
109.16: For he did not remember to show kindness, but pursued the poor and needy and broken-hearted to their death.
109.17: As he loved cursing, so let it come over him; as he did not delight in blessing, so let it be far from him.
109.18: As he clothed himself with cursing like a garment, so let it soak into him like water, and like oil into his bones.
109.19: Let it be unto him as the garment that covers him, and a belt that he continually wears.
109.20: Let this be the reward of my adversaries from the Lord, and of those who speak evil against my soul.
109.21: But You, O God my Lord, work on my behalf for your name’s sake; because your mercy is good, deliver me.
109.22: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
109.23: I am gone like a shadow in the evening; I am tossed as the locust.
109.24: My knees are weak through fasting, and my body is thin with no fat.
109.25: I am a reproach to my accusers; when they look upon me, they shake their heads.
109.26: Help me, O Lord my God! Save me according to Your mercy,
109.27: that they may know that this is by Your hand, that You, O Lord, have done it.
109.28: Let them curse, but You will bless; when they arise, let them be ashamed, but let Your servant rejoice.
109.29: Let my adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own disgrace like a cloak.
109.30: I will greatly praise the Lord with my mouth; indeed, I will praise Him among the multitude.
109.31: For He stands at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those who condemn his soul to death.

110.1: The Lord said to my lord, “Sit at My right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool.”
110.2: The Lord shall send your mighty scepter out of Zion; rule in the midst of your enemies.
110.3: Your people will follow you in the day of your battle; on the holy mountains at dawn of the morning, the dew of your youth belongs to you.
110.4: The Lord has sworn and will not change, “You are a priest forever after the order of Melchizedek.”
110.5: The Lord is at your right hand; He shall strike down kings in the day of His wrath.
110.6: He shall judge among the nations; He shall fill them with dead bodies; He shall scatter heads all over the land.
110.7: He shall drink of the brook in the path; then He shall lift up the head.

111.1: Praise the Lord! I will praise the Lord with my whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and in the congregation.
111.2: The works of the Lord are great, sought out by all who have pleasure in them.
111.3: His work is honorable and glorious, and His righteousness endures forever.
111.4: He has made His wonderful works to be remembered; the Lord is gracious and full of compassion.
111.5: He has given food to those who fear Him; He will ever be mindful of His covenant.
111.6: He has shown His people the power of His works, that He may give them the inheritance of the nations.
111.7: The works of His hands are true and just; all His commands are sure.
111.8: They stand forever and ever, and are done in truth and uprightness.
111.9: He sent redemption to His people; He has commanded His covenant forever; holy and fearful is His name.
111.10: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom; all who live it have insight. His praise endures forever!

112.1: Praise the Lord! Blessed is the man who fears the Lord, who delights greatly in His commandments.
112.2: His offspring shall be mighty in the land; the generation of the upright shall be blessed.
112.3: Wealth and riches shall be in his house, and his righteousness endures forever.
112.4: To the upright there arises light in the darkness; he is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.
112.5: A good man shows generous favor, and lends; he will guide his affairs with justice.
112.6: Surely the righteous man shall not be moved; the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.
112.7: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings; his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.
112.8: His heart is established; he shall not be afraid, until he sees triumph upon his enemies.
112.9: He has given away freely; he has given to the poor; his righteousness endures forever; his horn shall be exalted with honor.
112.10: The wicked shall see it and be grieved; he shall gnash his teeth and melt away; the desire of the wicked shall perish.

113.1: Praise the Lord! Praise, O you servants of the Lord, praise the name of the Lord.
113.2: Blessed be the name of the Lord from this time forth and for evermore.
113.3: From the rising of the sun to its going down, the Lord’s name is to be praised.
113.4: The Lord is high above all nations, and His glory above the heavens.
113.5: Who is like the Lord our God, who dwells on high,
113.6: who looks down on the things that are in heaven and on the earth?
113.7: He raises up the poor out of the dust and lifts the needy out of the ash heap,
113.8: to make them sit with princes, even with the princes of His people.
113.9: He gives the barren woman a dwelling, making her the joyful mother of children. Praise the Lord!

114.1: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,
114.2: Judah was His sanctuary, and Israel His dominion.
114.3: The sea saw it and fled; the Jordan was driven back;
114.4: the mountains skipped like rams and the hills like lambs.
114.5: What alarmed you, O sea, that you fled, O Jordan, that you turned back,
114.6: O mountains, that you skipped like rams, O hills, like lambs?
114.7: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob
114.8: who turned the rock into a pool of water, the hard stone into a spring of waters.

115.1: Not unto us, O Lord, not unto us, but unto Your name give glory, for the sake of Your mercy, and for the sake of Your truth.
115.2: Why should the nations say, “Where now is their God?”
115.3: But our God is in the heavens; He does whatever He pleases.
115.4: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
115.5: They have mouths, but they cannot speak; eyes, but they cannot see;
115.6: they have ears, but they cannot hear; noses, but they cannot smell;
115.7: they have hands, but they cannot feel; feet, but they cannot walk; neither can they speak with their throat.
115.8: Those who make them are like them; so is everyone who trusts in them.
115.9: O Israel, trust in the Lord; He is their help and their shield.
115.10: O house of Aaron, trust in the Lord; He is their help and their shield.
115.11: You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord; He is their help and their shield.
115.12: The Lord has been mindful of us; He will bless us; He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron.
115.13: He will bless those who fear the Lord, both the small and great ones.
115.14: The Lord shall increase you more and more, you and your children.
115.15: You are blessed of the Lord, who made heaven and earth.
115.16: The heavens belong to the Lord, but the earth He has given to the children of men.
115.17: The dead do not praise the Lord, nor do any who go down into silence.
115.18: But we will bless the Lord from this time and for evermore. Praise the Lord!

116.1: I love the Lord, because He has heard my voice and my supplications.
116.2: Because He has inclined His ear to me, therefore I will call upon Him as long as I live.
116.3: The cords of death encircled me, and the pains of Sheol took hold of me; I found trouble and sorrow.
116.4: Then called I upon the name of the Lord: “O Lord, I plead with You, deliver my soul.”
116.5: Gracious is the Lord, and righteous; indeed, our God is merciful.
116.6: The Lord protects the simple; I was brought low, and He helped me.
116.7: Return to your rest, O my soul; for the Lord has vindicated you.
116.8: For You have delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
116.9: I will walk before the Lord in the land of the living.
116.10: I believed, indeed I have spoken: “I am greatly afflicted.”
116.11: I said in my haste, “All men are liars.”
116.12: What shall I render unto the Lord for all His benefits toward me?
116.13: I will take the cup of salvation and call upon the name of the Lord.
116.14: I will pay my vows unto the Lord now in the presence of all His people.
116.15: Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of His godly ones.
116.16: O Lord, I am Your servant; I am Your servant, the son of Your female servant; You have loosed my bonds.
116.17: I will offer to You the sacrifice of thanksgiving and will call upon the name of the Lord.
116.18: I will pay my vows unto the Lord now in the presence of all His people,
116.19: in the courts of the house of the Lord, in your midst, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord!

117.1: Praise the Lord, all you nations! Exalt Him, all you peoples!
117.2: For His merciful kindness is great toward us, and the faithfulness of the Lord endures forever. Praise the Lord!

118.1: Oh, give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good, because His mercy endures forever.
118.2: Let Israel say, “His mercy endures forever.”
118.3: Let the house of Aaron say, “His mercy endures forever.”
118.4: Let those who fear the Lord say, “His mercy endures forever.”
118.5: I called upon the Lord from my distress; the Lord answered me and set me in an open place.
118.6: The Lord is on my side; I will not fear. What can people do to me?
118.7: The Lord is on my side to help me; I shall look in triumph upon those who hate me.
118.8: It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in man.
118.9: It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in princes.
118.10: All nations encircled me, but in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.
118.11: They circled me; indeed, they surrounded me, but in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.
118.12: They circled me like bees; they went forth as a fire over thorns, but in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.
118.13: You have pushed against me, that I was falling, but the Lord helped me.
118.14: The Lord is my strength and song; He has become my salvation.
118.15: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents of the righteous: “The right hand of the Lord is valiant.
118.16: The right hand of the Lord is exalted; the right hand of the Lord is valiant.”
118.17: I shall not die, but I shall live and declare the works of the Lord.
118.18: The Lord has severely chastened me, but He has not given me over unto death.
118.19: Open to me the gates of righteousness; I will go into them, and I will praise the Lord.
118.20: This is the gate of the Lord; the righteous shall enter through.
118.21: I will thank You that You have heard me and have become my deliverance.
118.22: The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
118.23: This is what the Lord has done; it is marvelous in our eyes.
118.24: This is the day that the Lord has made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
118.25: Save us, we ask You, O Lord; O Lord, we ask You, send now success.
118.26: Blessed be he that comes in the name of the Lord: we have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.
118.27: The Lord is God, and He has shown us His light; bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.
118.28: You are my God, and I will praise You; You are my God, I will exalt You.
118.29: Oh, give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good, for His mercy endures forever.

119.1: Blessed are those whose way is blameless, who walk in the law of the Lord.
119.2: Blessed are those who keep His testimonies, and who seek Him with all their heart.
119.3: They also do no wrong; they walk in His ways.
119.4: You have commanded us to keep Your precepts diligently.
119.5: Oh, that my ways were established to keep Your statutes!
119.6: Then I shall not be ashamed, when I have my focus on all Your commandments.
119.7: I will praise You with an upright heart, when I have learned Your righteous judgments.
119.8: I will keep Your statutes; do not completely abandon me.
119.9: How shall a young man keep his way pure? By keeping it according to Your word.
119.10: With my whole heart I seek You; do not allow me to wander from Your commandments.
119.11: Your word I have hidden in my heart, that I might not sin against You.
119.12: Blessed are You, O Lord; teach me Your statutes.
119.13: With my lips I declare all the decrees of Your mouth.
119.14: I rejoice in the way of Your testimonies, as much as in all riches.
119.15: I will meditate on Your precepts and keep my eyes on Your ways.
119.16: I will delight in Your statutes; I will not forget Your word.
119.17: Deal kindly with Your servant, that I may live and keep Your word.
119.18: Open my eyes, that I may behold wondrous things from Your law.
119.19: I am a sojourner in the land; do not hide Your commandments from me.
119.20: My soul is consumed all the time with a longing for Your decrees.
119.21: You have rebuked the proud, those cursed, who depart from Your commandments.
119.22: Remove from me reproach and contempt, for I have kept Your testimonies.
119.23: Even if princes sit and conspire against me, Your servant will meditate on Your statutes.
119.24: Your testimonies are my delight and my counselors.
119.25: My soul clings to the dust; revive me according to Your word.
119.26: I have declared my ways, and You heard me; teach me Your statutes.
119.27: Make me to understand the way of Your precepts; then I shall contemplate on Your wondrous works.
119.28: My soul collapses on account of grief; strengthen me according to Your word.
119.29: Remove from me the way of falsehood, and graciously grant me Your law.
119.30: I have chosen the way of faithfulness; Your judgments I have laid before me.
119.31: I have stayed with Your testimonies, O Lord; may I not be put to shame.
119.32: I will run in the way of Your commandments, when You set my heart free.
119.33: Teach me, O Lord, the way of Your statutes, and I shall keep it to the end.
119.34: Give me understanding, and I shall keep Your law and observe it with my whole heart.
119.35: Lead me in the path of Your commandments, for I delight in them.
119.36: Incline my heart unto Your testimonies, and not for unjust gain.
119.37: Turn away my eyes from beholding worthlessness, and revive me in Your way.
119.38: Establish Your word to Your servant, so that You are feared.
119.39: Turn away my reproach that I dread, for Your judgments are good.
119.40: Behold, I have a longing for Your precepts; revive me in Your righteousness.
119.41: Let Your mercies come to me, O Lord, even Your deliverance according to Your word.
119.42: So I shall have an answer for him who reproaches me, for I trust in Your word.
119.43: Do not take the word of truth out of my mouth, for I have hoped in Your judgments.
119.44: So I shall keep Your law continually, forever and ever.
119.45: I will walk in an open space, for I seek Your precepts.
119.46: I will speak of Your testimonies also before kings and will not be ashamed.
119.47: I will delight in Your commandments, which I have loved.
119.48: My hands I will lift up unto Your commandments, which I have loved; I will meditate on Your statutes.
119.49: Remember Your word to Your servant, on which You have caused me to hope.
119.50: This is my comfort in my affliction, for Your word revives me.
119.51: The proud ones have derided me, yet I have not forsaken Your law.
119.52: I remembered Your judgments of old, O Lord, and I have comforted myself.
119.53: Fury has taken hold of me because of the wicked who forsake Your law.
119.54: Your statutes have been my songs in the house of my temporary dwelling.
119.55: I have remembered Your name, O Lord, in the night, and have kept Your law.
119.56: This is my blessing, because I have kept Your precepts.
119.57: You are my portion, O Lord; I have said that I would keep Your words.
119.58: I seek Your favor with my whole heart; be merciful to me according to Your word.
119.59: I consider my ways, and I turn my feet to Your testimonies.
119.60: I made haste, and I did not delay to keep Your commandments.
119.61: The bands of the wicked have trapped me, but I have not forgotten Your law.
119.62: At midnight I will rise to give thanks to You, because of Your righteous judgments.
119.63: I am a companion of all who fear You, and of those who keep Your precepts.
119.64: The earth, O Lord, is full of Your mercy; teach me Your statutes.
119.65: You have been good to Your servant, O Lord, according to Your word.
119.66: Teach me good discernment and knowledge, for I have believed Your commandments.
119.67: Before I was afflicted I wandered, but now I keep Your word.
119.68: You are good and do good; teach me Your statutes.
119.69: The proud have spoken lies against me, but I keep Your precepts with my whole heart.
119.70: Their heart is as thick as fat, but I delight in Your law.
119.71: It is good for me that I have been afflicted, that I might learn Your statutes.
119.72: The law from Your mouth is better to me than thousands of gold and silver coins.
119.73: Your hands have made me and fashioned me; give me understanding, that I may learn Your commandments.
119.74: Those who fear You will be glad when they see me, because I have hoped in Your word.
119.75: I know, O Lord, that Your judgments are right, and that You in faithfulness have afflicted me.
119.76: Let Your merciful kindness comfort me, according to Your word to Your servant.
119.77: Let Your compassion come to me, that I may live, for Your law is my delight.
119.78: Let the proud be ashamed, for they have been wicked to me in falsehood, but I will meditate on Your precepts.
119.79: Let those who fear You turn to me, that they might know Your testimonies.
119.80: Let my heart be blameless in Your statutes, that I may not be ashamed.
119.81: My soul longs for Your deliverance, but I hope in Your word.
119.82: My eyes are weary for Your word, saying, “When will You comfort me?”
119.83: For I have become like a wineskin dried in the smoke, yet I have not forgotten Your statutes.
119.84: How many days are given to Your servant? When will You provide judgment on those who persecute me?
119.85: The proud have dug pits for me, and they do not live in accordance to Your law.
119.86: All Your commandments are faithful; I am persecuted without cause; help me!
119.87: They have almost consumed me on the earth, but I have not abandoned Your precepts.
119.88: Revive me according to Your lovingkindness, that I may keep the testimony from Your mouth.
119.89: Forever, O Lord, Your word is established in heaven.
119.90: Your faithfulness is for all generations; You have established the earth, and it is firm.
119.91: They continue this day according to Your ordinance, for all are Your servants.
119.92: Unless Your law had been my delight, I would have perished in my affliction.
119.93: I will never forget Your precepts, for with them You have revived me.
119.94: I am Yours; deliver me, for I have sought Your precepts.
119.95: The wicked have waited to destroy me, but I will consider Your testimonies.
119.96: I have seen that all perfection has an end, but Your commandment is quite broad.
119.97: Oh, how I love Your law! It is my meditation all the day.
119.98: Your commandments have made me wiser than my enemies, for they are continually with me.
119.99: I have more understanding than all my teachers, for Your testimonies are my meditation.
119.100: I understand more than the elders, because I keep Your precepts.
119.101: I have restrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep Your word.
119.102: I have not departed from Your judgments, for You have taught me.
119.103: How sweet are Your words to the taste of my mouth! Sweeter than honey to my mouth!
119.104: Through Your precepts I receive understanding; therefore I hate every false way.
119.105: Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.
119.106: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep Your righteous judgments.
119.107: I am greatly afflicted; revive me, O Lord, according to Your word.
119.108: Accept the freewill offerings of my praise, O Lord, and teach me Your judgments.
119.109: My soul is continually in my hand, yet I do not forget Your law.
119.110: The wicked have laid a trap for me, yet I do not depart from Your precepts.
119.111: Your testimonies are my inheritance forever, for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
119.112: I have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes always, even unto the end.
119.113: I hate those who are double-minded, but I love Your law.
119.114: You are my hiding place and my shield, I hope in Your word.
119.115: Depart from me, you who are wicked, for I keep the commandments of my God.
119.116: Uphold me according to Your word, that I may live, and let me not be ashamed with my hope.
119.117: Hold me up, and I shall be safe, and I will have respect for Your statutes continually.
119.118: You have rejected all those who stray from Your statutes, for their deceit is falsehood.
119.119: You put away all the wicked of the earth like dross; therefore I love Your testimonies.
119.120: My body trembles for fear of You, and I am afraid of Your judgments.
119.121: I have done what is right and just; do not abandon me to my oppressors.
119.122: Be true to Your servant for good; let not the proud ones oppress me.
119.123: My eyes long for Your deliverance and for the promise of Your righteousness.
119.124: Deal with Your servant according to Your mercy, and teach me Your statutes.
119.125: I am Your servant; grant me understanding, that I may know Your testimonies.
119.126: It is time for You, O Lord, to act, for they have broken Your law.
119.127: Therefore I love Your commandments above gold, even fine gold.
119.128: For I follow all Your precepts to be right, and I hate every false way.
119.129: Your testimonies are wonderful; therefore my soul keeps them.
119.130: The giving of Your words gives light; it grants understanding to the simple.
119.131: I opened my mouth and panted, for I long for Your commandments.
119.132: Look upon me, and be merciful to me, as You are for those who love Your name.
119.133: Order my steps according to Your word, and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
119.134: Deliver me from the oppression of man, so I will keep Your precepts.
119.135: Make Your face to shine upon Your servant, and teach me Your statutes.
119.136: Rivers of waters run down my eyes, because people do not keep Your law.
119.137: You are righteous, O Lord, and upright are Your judgments.
119.138: You have set Your testimonies in righteousness and faithfulness.
119.139: My zeal has consumed me, because my enemies have forgotten Your words.
119.140: Your word is pure and true; therefore Your servant loves it.
119.141: I am small and despised, yet I do not forget Your precepts.
119.142: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and Your law is true.
119.143: Trouble and anguish have discovered me, but Your commandments are my delight.
119.144: The righteousness of Your testimonies is everlasting; grant me understanding, and I shall live.
119.145: I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O Lord, I will keep Your statutes.
119.146: I cried unto You; deliver me, and I shall keep Your testimonies.
119.147: I arose before the dawn of the morning and cried for help; I hope in Your words.
119.148: My eyes are awake before the night watches, that I might meditate on Your word.
119.149: Hear my voice according to Your lovingkindness, O Lord; revive me according to Your judgment.
119.150: They draw close, those who persecute me with evil; they are far from Your law.
119.151: But You are near, O Lord, and all Your commandments are true.
119.152: I have known of old that You have established Your testimonies forever.
119.153: Consider my affliction, and deliver me, for I do not forget Your law.
119.154: Plead my cause, and defend me; revive me according to Your word.
119.155: Salvation is far from the wicked, for they do not seek Your statutes.
119.156: Great are Your compassions, O Lord; revive me according to Your judgments.
119.157: Many are my persecutors and my enemies, yet I do not turn from Your testimonies.
119.158: I behold the transgressors with disgust, because they have not kept Your word.
119.159: Consider how I love Your precepts; revive me, O Lord, according to Your lovingkindness.
119.160: Your word is true from the beginning, and every one of Your righteous judgments endures forever.
119.161: Princes have persecuted me without a cause, but my heart stands in awe of Your words.
119.162: I rejoice at Your word, as one who finds great plunder.
119.163: I hate and abhor lying, but I love Your law.
119.164: Seven times a day I praise You, because of Your righteous judgments.
119.165: Those who love Your law have great peace, and nothing shall cause them to stumble.
119.166: Lord, I have hoped for Your deliverance, and I carry out Your commandments.
119.167: My soul has kept Your testimonies, and I love them greatly.
119.168: I have kept Your precepts and Your testimonies, for all my ways are before You.
119.169: Let my cry come near before You, O Lord; give me understanding according to Your word.
119.170: Let my supplication come before You; deliver me according to Your word.
119.171: My lips shall declare praise, for You have taught me Your statutes.
119.172: My tongue shall speak of Your word, for all Your commandments are right.
119.173: Let Your hand help me, for I have chosen Your precepts.
119.174: I have longed for Your salvation, O Lord, and Your law is my delight.
119.175: Let my soul live and praise You, and let Your judgments come to my aid.
119.176: I have wandered like a lost sheep; seek Your servant, for I do not forget Your commandments.

120.1: In my distress I cried unto the Lord, and He heard me.
120.2: Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips and from a deceitful tongue.
120.3: What shall be given to you, or what shall be done to you, you false tongue?
120.4: Sharp arrows of the warrior, with coals of the broom tree!
120.5: Woe is me, that I have sojourned in Meshek, or that I have dwelled among the tents of Kedar!
120.6: My soul has long lived with those who hate peace.
120.7: I am for peace, but when I speak, they are for war!

121.1: I will lift up my eyes to the hills, from where does my help come?
121.2: My help comes from the Lord, who made heaven and earth.
121.3: He will not let your foot slip; He who keeps you will not slumber.
121.4: Behold, He who guards Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.
121.5: The Lord is your guardian; the Lord is your shade at your right hand.
121.6: The sun shall not harm you during the day, nor the moon during the night.
121.7: The Lord shall protect you from all evil; He shall preserve your soul.
121.8: The Lord shall preserve your going out and your coming in from now and for evermore.

122.1: I was glad when they said to me, “Let us go into the house of the Lord.”
122.2: Our feet shall stand within your gates, O Jerusalem.
122.3: Jerusalem is built as a city that is designed for a multitude,
122.4: where the tribes go up, the tribes of the Lord, as a decree of Israel, to give thanks unto the name of the Lord.
122.5: There are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
122.6: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: “May they prosper who love you!
122.7: Peace be within your walls and security within your towers!”
122.8: For my brothers and companions’ sake, I will now say, “Peace be within you.”
122.9: Because of the house of the Lord our God, I will seek your good.

123.1: To You I lift up my eyes, O You who dwell in the heavens.
123.2: Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master, and as the eyes of a maiden to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes look upon the Lord our God, until He has mercy upon us.
123.3: Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us, for we have been completely filled with contempt.
123.4: Our soul is exceedingly filled with the ridicule of those who are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud ones.

124.1: If it had not been the Lord who was on our side, now may Israel say,
124.2: if it had not been the Lord who was on our side, when men rose up against us,
124.3: then they would have swallowed us up, when their wrath was kindled against us;
124.4: then the flood would have overwhelmed us, the torrent would have passed over our lives;
124.5: then the surging waters would have gone over us.
124.6: Blessed be the Lord, who has not given us for a prey to their teeth.
124.7: We have escaped as a bird out of the snare of the hunters; the snare is broken, and we have escaped.
124.8: Our help is in the name of the Lord, who made heaven and earth.

125.1: Those who trust in the Lord shall be as Mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but abides forever.
125.2: As the mountains are around Jerusalem, so the Lord surrounds His people, from now and forever.
125.3: For the scepter of the wicked shall not rest upon the land allotted to the righteous, lest the righteous put forth their hands to do iniquity.
125.4: Do good, O Lord, for those who are good, and to those who are upright in their hearts.
125.5: As for those who turn aside to their twisted ways, the Lord shall lead them away with the other workers of iniquity. Peace be upon Israel!

126.1: When the Lord restored the captives of Zion, we were like those who dream.
126.2: Then our mouth was filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing. Then they said among the nations, “The Lord has done great things for them.”
126.3: The Lord has done great things for us; we are glad.
126.4: Restore our captives, O Lord, as the streams in the Negev.
126.5: Those who sow in tears shall reap in joy.
126.6: He who goes forth and weeps, bearing precious seed to sow, shall come home again with rejoicing, bringing his grain sheaves with him.

127.1: Except the Lord build the house, those who build labor in vain; except the Lord guards the city, the watchman stays awake in vain.
127.2: It is in vain for you to rise up early, to stay up late, and to eat the bread of hard toil, for He gives sleep to His beloved.
127.3: Look, children are a gift of the Lord, and the fruit of the womb is a reward.
127.4: As arrows in the hand of a mighty warrior, so are the children of one’s youth.
127.5: Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them; he shall not be ashamed when he speaks with the enemies at the gate.

128.1: Blessed is everyone who fears the Lord, who walks in His ways.
128.2: For you shall eat the fruit of the labor of your hands; you will be happy, and it shall be well with you.
128.3: Your wife shall be as a fruitful vine in your house, your children like olive shoots around your table.
128.4: Behold, this man shall be blessed who fears the Lord.
128.5: The Lord shall bless you from Zion, and may you see the welfare of Jerusalem all the days of your life.
128.6: Indeed, may you see your children’s children. Peace upon Israel!

129.1: “Often they have afflicted me from my youth,” may Israel now say,
129.2: “often they have afflicted me from my youth, yet they have not prevailed against me.
129.3: The plowmen plowed upon my back; they made their furrows long.”
129.4: The Lord is righteous; He has cut the cords of the wicked.
129.5: Let all those be shamed and turned back who hate Zion.
129.6: Let them be as the grass on the housetops, which withers before it even grows,
129.7: where the reaper is unable to fill his hand, or he who binds sheaves, his arms.
129.8: Neither do they who pass by say, “The blessing of the Lord be upon you; we bless you in the name of the Lord!”

130.1: From the depths I call on You, O Lord!
130.2: O Lord, hear my voice; let Your ears be attentive to the sound of my supplications.
130.3: If you, O Lord, should keep track of iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?
130.4: For there is forgiveness with You, that You may be feared.
130.5: I wait for the Lord, with bated breath I wait; I long for His Word!
130.6: My soul waits for the Lord, more than watchmen for the morning, more than watchmen for the morning.
130.7: Let Israel wait for the Lord! For mercy is found with the Lord; with Him is great redemption.
130.8: He shall redeem Israel from all their iniquities.

131.1: Lord, my heart is not haughty, my eyes are not raised too high. I have not striven for enormities, for things too wonderful for me.
131.2: I composed and quieted my desire, like a child given suck by his mother; like a child who sucks is my desire within me.
131.3: Let Israel hope in the Lord from now and forever.

132.1: O Lord, remember David and all his afflictions,
132.2: how he swore unto the Lord, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob:
132.3: “I will not come into my house, nor go up to my bed;
132.4: I will not give sleep to my eyes, or slumber to my eyelids,
132.5: until I find a place for the Lord, a dwelling for the mighty God of Jacob.”
132.6: We heard of it in Ephrathah; we found it in the fields of Jaar.
132.7: “We will go to His dwelling place, we will worship at His footstool.”
132.8: Arise, O Lord, go to Your resting place, You and the ark of Your strength.
132.9: Let Your priests be clothed with righteousness, and let Your godly ones shout for joy.
132.10: For Your servant David’s sake, do not turn away Your anointed king.
132.11: The Lord has sworn with a sure oath to David that He will not turn from it: “From the fruit of your body I will set a son on your throne.
132.12: If your children will keep My covenant and My testimonies that I shall teach them, then their children shall also sit upon your throne forever.”
132.13: For the Lord has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His dwelling:
132.14: “This is My resting place forever; here I will dwell, for I have chosen it.
132.15: I will abundantly bless her provisions; I will satisfy her poor with bread.
132.16: I will also clothe her priests with salvation, and her godly ones shall shout for joy.
132.17: “There I will make a horn sprout for David; I have prepared a lamp for My anointed one.
132.18: His enemies I will clothe with shame, but on him his crown will shine.”

133.1: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to dwell together in unity!
133.2: It is like precious oil upon the head, that runs down on the beard— even Aaron’s beard— and going down to the collar of his garments;
133.3: as the dew of Hermon, that descends upon the mountains of Zion, for there the Lord has commanded the blessing, even life forever.

134.1: Come, bless the Lord, all you servants of the Lord, who by night stand in the house of the Lord.
134.2: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the Lord.
134.3: May the Lord who made heaven and earth bless you from Zion.

135.1: Praise the Lord! Praise the name of the Lord praise Him, O servants of the Lord,
135.2: you who stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God!
135.3: Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good; sing praises unto His name, for it is pleasant.
135.4: For the Lord has chosen Jacob for Himself, and Israel for His special possession.
135.5: For I know that the Lord is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.
135.6: Whatever the Lord pleases, He does in heaven and on earth, in the seas and all the depths.
135.7: He causes the clouds to ascend from the ends of the earth; He makes lightning for the rain; He brings the wind out from His storehouses.
135.8: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and animal.
135.9: He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants;
135.10: He struck down great nations and slew mighty kings—
135.11: Sihon, king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan—
135.12: and gave their land for an inheritance, a possession to Israel His people.
135.13: Your name, O Lord, endures forever; and Your renown, O Lord, throughout all generations.
135.14: For the Lord will defend His people, and He will have compassion on His servants.
135.15: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
135.16: They have mouths, but do not speak; they have eyes, but do not see;
135.17: they have ears, but do not hear; neither is there any breath in their mouths.
135.18: Those who make them are like them; so is everyone who trusts in them.
135.19: Bless the Lord, O house of Israel; bless the Lord, O house of Aaron.
135.20: Bless the Lord, O house of Levi; you who fear the Lord, bless the Lord.
135.21: Blessed be the Lord from Zion, who dwells at Jerusalem. Praise you the Lord!

136.1: Oh, give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good, for His mercy endures forever.
136.2: Oh, give thanks unto the God of gods, for His mercy endures forever.
136.3: Oh, give thanks to the Lord of lords, for His mercy endures forever:
136.4: to Him who alone does great wonders, for His mercy endures forever;
136.5: to Him who by wisdom made the heavens, for His mercy endures forever;
136.6: to Him who stretched out the earth above the waters, for His mercy endures forever;
136.7: to Him who made the great heavenly lights, for His mercy endures forever;
136.8: the sun to rule over the day, for His mercy endures forever;
136.9: the moon and stars to rule over the night, for His mercy endures forever;
136.10: to Him who struck down in Egypt their firstborn, for His mercy endures forever;
136.11: and brought out Israel from among them, for His mercy endures forever;
136.12: with a strong hand and a stretched-out arm, for His mercy endures forever;
136.13: to Him who divided the Red Sea into two, for His mercy endures forever;
136.14: and made Israel to pass through the midst of it, for His mercy endures forever;
136.15: but overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea, for His mercy endures forever;
136.16: to Him who led His people through the wilderness, for His mercy endures forever;
136.17: to Him who struck down great kings, for His mercy endures forever;
136.18: and slew mighty kings, for His mercy endures forever;
136.19: Sihon king of the Amorites, for His mercy endures forever;
136.20: and Og king of Bashan, for His mercy endures forever;
136.21: and gave their land for a possession, for His mercy endures forever;
136.22: even an inheritance to Israel His servant, for His mercy endures forever.
136.23: Who remembered us in our low place, for His mercy endures forever;
136.24: and has redeemed us from our enemies, for His mercy endures forever;
136.25: who gives food to all people, for His mercy endures forever.
136.26: Give thanks unto the God of heaven, for His mercy endures forever.

137.1: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down and wept when we remembered Zion.
137.2: We hung our harps upon the poplars.
137.3: For there our captors made us sing and our tormentors made us entertain, saying, “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
137.4: How shall we sing the song of the Lord in a foreign land?
137.5: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget its skill.
137.6: If I do not remember you, let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth, if I do not have Jerusalem as my highest joy.
137.7: Remember, O Lord, the people of Edom in the day of Jerusalem, who said, “Raze it, raze it, down to its foundations.”
137.8: O daughter of Babylon, who is to be destroyed, blessed is the one who rewards you as you have done to us.
137.9: Blessed is the one who takes and dashes your little ones against the rocks.

138.1: I will praise You, O Lord, with my whole heart; before the gods I will sing Your praise.
138.2: I will worship toward Your holy temple, and praise Your name for Your lovingkindness and for Your truth; for You have exalted Your word above all Your name.
138.3: On the day I called, You answered me, and strengthened me in my soul.
138.4: All the kings of the earth shall praise You, O Lord, for they have heard the words of Your mouth.
138.5: Indeed, they shall sing of the ways of the Lord, for great is the glory of the Lord.
138.6: Though the Lord is exalted, yet He has concern for the lowly, but the proud one He knows from a distance.
138.7: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, You will preserve me; You stretch forth Your hand against the wrath of my enemies, and Your right hand saves me.
138.8: The Lord will fulfill His purpose for me; Your mercy, O Lord, endures forever; do not forsake the works of Your hands.

139.1: O Lord, You have searched me and known me.
139.2: You know when I sit down and when I get up; You understand my thought from far off.
139.3: You search my path and my lying down and are aware of all my ways.
139.4: For there is not a word on my tongue, but behold, O Lord, You know it fully.
139.5: You put Yourself behind and before me, and keep Your hand on me.
139.6: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is lofty, and I cannot fathom it.
139.7: Where shall I go from Your spirit, or where shall I flee from Your presence?
139.8: If I ascend to heaven, You are there; if I make my bed in Sheol, You are there.
139.9: If I take the wings of the morning and dwell at the end of the sea,
139.10: even there Your hand shall guide me, and Your right hand shall take hold of me.
139.11: If I say, “Surely the darkness shall cover me, and the light shall be as night about me,”
139.12: even the darkness is not dark to You, but the night shines as the day, for the darkness is like light to You.
139.13: You brought my inner parts into being; You wove me in my mother’s womb.
139.14: I will praise you, for You made me with fear and wonder; marvelous are Your works, and You know me completely.
139.15: My frame was not hidden from You when I was made in secret, and intricately put together in the lowest parts of the earth.
139.16: Your eyes saw me unformed, yet in Your book all my days were written, before any of them came into being.
139.17: How precious also are Your thoughts to me, O God! How great is the sum of them!
139.18: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand; when I awake, I am still with You.
139.19: If only You would slay the wicked, O God! O violent men, depart from me.
139.20: For they speak against You with malice, and Your enemies take your name in vain.
139.21: Do I not hate those, O Lord, who hate You? And do I not abhor those who rise up against You?
139.22: I hate them with perfect hatred; I count them my enemies.
139.23: Search me, O God, and know my heart; try me, and know my concerns,
139.24: and see if there is any rebellious way in me, and lead me in the ancient way.

140.1: Deliver me, O Lord, from evil men; protect me from violent men,
140.2: who plan evil deeds in their heart and continually gather together for conflicts.
140.3: They have tongues as sharp as a serpent; adders’ poison is with their lips. Selah
140.4: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent men who have planned to overthrow me.
140.5: The proud have hid a snare for me, and with cords they have spread a net; they have set traps for me. Selah
140.6: I said to the Lord, “You are my God; hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.”
140.7: O God my Lord, the strength of my salvation, You have covered my head in the day of battle.
140.8: Grant not, O Lord, the desires of the wicked; do not allow his evil plot, lest he be raised up. Selah
140.9: As for the head of those who encompass me, let the mischief of their own lips overwhelm them;
140.10: let burning coals fall upon them; let them be cast into the fire, into deep pits that they do not rise up again.
140.11: Let not an evil speaker be established in the land; let evil hunt the violent man to overthrow him!
140.12: I know that the Lord will maintain the cause of the afflicted and will give justice to the poor.
140.13: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto Your name; the upright shall dwell in Your presence.

141.1: Lord, I cry unto You; make haste to me; give ear to my voice, when I cry unto You.
141.2: Let my prayer be set forth before You as incense, and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
141.3: Set a guard, O Lord, over my mouth; keep watch over the door of my lips.
141.4: Do not let my heart be drawn to any evil, to practice wicked deeds with men who do iniquity, and do not let me eat of their delights.
141.5: Let the righteous man strike me; it shall be a kindness. Let him rebuke me; it shall be oil for my head; let my head not refuse it. For my prayer is continually against their evil deeds.
141.6: When their judges are thrown to stony places, then they shall hear my words, for they are sweet.
141.7: As when one plows to break up the land, so our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
141.8: But my eyes are unto You, O God my Lord, in You is my trust; do not leave my soul defenseless.
141.9: Keep me from the snares that they have laid for me, and the traps of those who do iniquity.
141.10: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I pass by and escape.

142.1: I cried unto the Lord with my voice; with my voice I made my supplication unto the Lord.
142.2: I poured out my complaint before Him; I declared to Him my trouble.
142.3: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then You knew my path. In the way where I walk, they have laid a snare for me.
142.4: I looked on my right and noticed, but there was no one who would care for me; there is no refuge for me; no one cares for my soul.
142.5: I cried unto You, O Lord; I said, “You are my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.”
142.6: Attend to my cry, for I am brought very low; deliver me from my persecutors, for they are stronger than me.
142.7: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise Your name; the righteous shall surround me, for You shall deal bountifully with me.

143.1: Hear my prayer, O Lord, give ear to my supplications; in Your faithfulness answer me, and in Your righteousness.
143.2: Enter not into judgment with Your servant, for in Your sight no one living is righteous.
143.3: For the enemy has persecuted my soul; he has crushed my life down to the ground; he has made me to dwell in darkness, as those who have been long dead.
143.4: Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.
143.5: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all Your works; I consider the work of Your hands.
143.6: I stretch forth my hands unto You; my soul thirsts after You as a thirsty land. Selah
143.7: Respond to me quickly, O Lord, my spirit fails; do not hide Your face from me, lest I be like those who go down into the pit.
143.8: Cause me to hear Your lovingkindness in the morning; for in You I have my trust; cause me to know the way I should walk, for I lift up my soul unto You.
143.9: Deliver me, O Lord, from my enemies; I flee unto You for my protection.
143.10: Teach me to do Your will, for You are my God; may Your good spirit lead me onto level ground.
143.11: Revive me, O Lord, for Your name’s sake, for Your righteousness’ sake bring my soul out of trouble.
143.12: In Your mercy cut off my enemies, and destroy all them who afflict my soul, for I am Your servant.

144.1: Blessed be the Lord my strength, who prepares my hands for war, and my fingers to fight;
144.2: my goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer, my shield, and in whom I trust; who subdues nations under me.
144.3: O Lord, who is man that You take notice of him or the son of a man that You make account of him?
144.4: Man is like a breath; his days are as a shadow that passes away.
144.5: Bow your heavens, O Lord, and come down; touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
144.6: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them; shoot out Your arrows, and destroy them.
144.7: Send Your hand from above; rescue me, and deliver me out of the great waters, from the hand of foreigners,
144.8: whose mouth speaks lies, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.9: I will sing a new song unto You, O God, on a harp and an instrument of ten strings I will sing praises unto You;
144.10: it is He who gives victory to kings, who delivers David His servant from the cruel sword.
144.11: Rescue me and deliver me from the hand of foreigners, whose mouths speak lies and whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.12: May our sons in their youth be like plants full grown, and our daughters like cornerstones, cut in the similitude of a palace,
144.13: that our granaries may be full, providing all manner of produce, that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our fields,
144.14: and may our cattle be strong in labor. May there be no breaking in or going out, and no wailing in our streets.
144.15: Blessed are the people who have such things; indeed, blessed are the people whose God is the Lord.

145.1: I will exalt you, my God and King, and I will bless Your name forever and ever.
145.2: Every day I will bless You, and I will praise Your name forever and ever.
145.3: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised, and His greatness is unfathomable.
145.4: One generation shall praise Your works to another and shall declare Your mighty acts.
145.5: I will speak of the glorious honor of Your majesty and of Your wondrous works.
145.6: They shall speak of the might of Your awesome acts, and I will declare Your greatness.
145.7: They shall abundantly declare the fame of Your great goodness and shall sing of Your righteousness.
145.8: The Lord is gracious and full of compassion, slow to anger, and great in mercy.
145.9: The Lord is good to all, and His compassion is over all His works.
145.10: All Your works shall praise You, O Lord, and Your godly ones shall bless You.
145.11: They shall speak of the glory of Your kingdom and talk of Your power,
145.12: to make known to people His mighty acts, and the glorious majesty of His kingdom.
145.13: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and Your dominion endures throughout all generations.
145.14: The Lord upholds all who fall, and raises up all who are bowed down.
145.15: The eyes of all wait upon You, and You give them their food in due season.
145.16: You open Your hand and satisfy the desire of every living thing.
145.17: The Lord is righteous in all His ways and loving in all His works.
145.18: The Lord is near to all those who call upon Him, to all who call upon Him in truth.
145.19: He will fulfill the desire of those who fear Him; He also will hear their cry and will save them.
145.20: The Lord preserves all those who love Him, but all the wicked He will destroy.
145.21: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord, and let all people bless His holy name forever and ever.

146.1: Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord, O my soul!
146.2: While I live I will praise the Lord; I will sing praises unto my God while I have my life.
146.3: Do not put your trust in princes, nor in a son of man, in whom there is no help.
146.4: His breath leaves him, and he returns to the earth; on that very day his plans perish.
146.5: Blessed is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the Lord his God,
146.6: who made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, who keeps faithfulness forever,
146.7: who executes justice for the oppressed, who gives food to the hungry. The Lord releases the prisoners.
146.8: The Lord opens the eyes of the blind; the Lord raises those who are brought down; the Lord loves the righteous.
146.9: The Lord preserves the sojourners; He lifts up the fatherless and widow, but on the way of the wicked He brings disaster.
146.10: The Lord shall reign forever, your God, O Zion, unto all generations. Praise you the Lord!

147.1: Praise the Lord! For it is good to sing praises unto our God; for it is pleasant, and a song of praise is fitting.
147.2: The Lord builds up Jerusalem; He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.
147.3: He heals the broken in heart, and binds up their wounds.
147.4: He counts the number of the stars; He calls them all by their names.
147.5: Great is our Lord and great in power; His understanding is without measure.
147.6: The Lord lifts up the meek; He casts the wicked down to the ground.
147.7: Sing unto the Lord with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God:
147.8: who covers the heaven with clouds, who provides rain for the earth, who makes grass to grow upon the mountains.
147.9: He gives food to the animals and to the young ravens that chirp.
147.10: He delights not in the strength of the horse, nor does He take pleasure in the legs of a man,
147.11: but the Lord takes pleasure in those who fear Him, in those who hope in His mercy.
147.12: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem; praise your God, O Zion.
147.13: For He has strengthened the bars of your gates; He has blessed your children within you.
147.14: He makes peace in your borders, and fills you with the finest of the wheat.
147.15: He sends forth His commandment on the earth; His word goes out swiftly.
147.16: He gives snow like wool; He scatters the frost like ashes;
147.17: He casts forth His ice like morsels; who can stand before His cold?
147.18: He sends out His word and melts them; He causes His wind to blow and the waters flow.
147.19: He shows His word to Jacob, and His statutes and His judgments to Israel.
147.20: He has not dealt so with any other nation; they have not known His judgments. Praise the Lord!

148.1: Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord from the heavens; praise Him in the heights.
148.2: Praise Him, all His angels; praise Him, all His heavenly hosts.
148.3: Praise Him, sun and moon; praise Him, all you stars of light.
148.4: Praise Him, you highest of heavens, and you waters that are above the skies.
148.5: Let them praise the name of the Lord, for He commanded, and they were created.
148.6: He has also established them forever and ever; He has made a decree that shall not pass away.
148.7: Praise the Lord from the earth, you great sea creatures, and all you depths,
148.8: fire and hail, snow and mist, storming wind fulfilling His word,
148.9: mountains and all hills, fruitful trees and all cedars;
148.10: animals and all cattle, creeping things and flying birds;
148.11: kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all rulers of the earth;
148.12: both young men and maidens, old men and children.
148.13: Let them praise the name of the Lord, for His name alone is excellent; His glory is above the earth and heaven.
148.14: He has raised up a victory horn for His people, praise for all His saints, even for the people of Israel near Him. Praise the Lord!

149.1: Praise the Lord! Sing unto the Lord a new song, and His praise in the assembly of the godly ones.
149.2: Let Israel rejoice in its Maker; let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
149.3: Let them praise His name with dancing; let them sing praises unto Him with the tambourine and harp.
149.4: For the Lord takes pleasure in His people; He will beautify the meek with salvation.
149.5: Let the godly ones be joyful in glory; let them sing for joy on their beds.
149.6: Let the high praises of God be in their mouths, and two-edged swords in their hands,
149.7: to execute vengeance on the nations, and punishments on the peoples;
149.8: to bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with shackles of iron;
149.9: to execute upon them the written judgment; this is honor for all His godly ones. Praise the Lord!

150.1: Praise the Lord! Praise God in His sanctuary; praise Him in the firmament of His power!
150.2: Praise Him for His mighty acts; praise Him according to His excellent greatness!
150.3: Praise Him with the sound of the trumpet; praise Him with the lyre and harp!
150.4: Praise Him with the tambourine and dancing; praise Him with stringed instruments and flute!
150.5: Praise Him with loud cymbals; praise Him with the clanging cymbals!
150.6: Let everything that has breath praise the Lord. Praise the Lord!
